title: Senior Business Analyst
job_description: Job Description SummaryFor over forty years, HarbourVest has been home to a committed team of professionals with an entrepreneurial spirit and a desire to deliver impactful solutions to our clients and investing partners. As our global firm grows, we continue to add individuals who seek a collaborative, open-door culture that values diversity and innovative thinking.In our collegial environment that’s marked by low turnover and high energy, you’ll be inspired to grow and thrive. Here, you will be encouraged to build on your strengths and acquire new skills and experiences.We are committed to fostering an environment of inclusion that promotes mutual respect among all employees. Understanding and valuing these differences optimizes the potential of both the individual and the firm.HarbourVest is an equal opportunity employer.This position will be a hybrid work arrangement, which translates to 2-3 days minimum per week in the office.This Senior Business Analyst role will contribute to the Vanguard Platform and Services team within the IT organization. HarbourVest established a strategic partnership with Vanguard to offer an industry-first product that offers private equity investments to eligible retail investors. These products and services have been growing since their inception 3 years ago and this role will continue to advance the growth of these investment products and the enabling platforms.The ideal candidate is someone who:Consistently performs with a positive and proactive attitude to understand business needs and contributes to technology solutions that achieve business and client objectives. Builds and maintains effective working relationships with internal and external teammates. Operates with a continuous learning and improvement approach to deliver high quality and timely outcomes. Collaborates optimally with diverse roles and teams both in person and remote to achieve collective goals. What you will do:Contribute to product roadmap development and delivery to achieve strategic business objectives. Engage business and technology partners to define and document requirements, features or user stories, while proactively identifying and mitigating related dependencies or risks. Provides input and feedback relating to solutions alternatives and prioritization to support delivering the highest business value. Coordinates with teammates to iterate on feature development, testing and readiness. Develops test plans and supports testing to ensure the technical development enables the business needs. Drive effective business use by assisting in the day-to-day platform support, including the management of system upgrades, releases, and change control processes. Proactively seeks out challenges to identify and resolve potential issues with new development or ongoing operational support. Identifies and implements efficiencies to optimize capabilities. Conduct or facilitate training and information sharing sessions with supporting documentation or reference material for employees and team members as needed. Additional responsibilities related to the role as required. What you bring:Proven capabilities and experience in three or more of the following areas : Applications Development, Business Process and Workflow Management, Enterprise Architecture, Project Management, Quality Assurance, Infrastructure, and Systems Support. Background in Financial Services and/or financial applications; including experience with transactional systems. Experience with Agile software development, traditional project management, and Six Sigma methodologies and techniques. Successful results with large or sophisticated projects and processes from initiation through implementation. Effective interpersonal and communication skills, both written and verbal, including experience translating business and technical concepts or decisions with diverse audiences. Strengths with analytical, data, problem solving and collaboration skills. Experience with systems integrations and data mapping preferred. Attention to detail and quality to fulfill responsibilities. Proficient with Microsoft Office, process/workflow and collaboration tools. Education PreferredBachelor of Arts (B.A) or Science (B.S), or equivalent experienceExperience3-8 years or more, in Financial Services preferred
Industries: Venture Capital and Private Equity Principals

title: Business Analyst/QA Analyst
job_description: Title: Business Analyst/QA AnalystLocation: Everett, MA (Hybrid)Duration: Multi Year Renewable ContractHours: 37.5 Weekly Hours  Overview: Client is seeking a dynamic and versatile Business Analyst/Quality Assurance Analyst to join our Salesforce Center of Excellence Team. This role will primarily involve engaging in business analysis activities to gather requirements, analyzeprocesses, and define solutions (60 percent), with a secondary focus on quality assurance to ensure the delivery of high-quality products and services (40 percent). The ideal candidate will have a solid understanding of both business analysis and quality assurance methodologies, with experience in wireframing (visual representation, UX design, iterative design, and prototyping) a plus. Duties and Responsibilities:Business AnalysisCollaborate with product owners and other business stakeholders to elicit, analyze, and document business requirements.Conduct interviews, workshops, and meetings to gather and validate requirements.Translate business needs into functional specifications and user stories.Create and maintain documentation such as process flows, use cases, and business rules in Confluence and SharePoint.Assist in the development of wireframes and prototypes.Log and manage tasks, user stories, and defects in Jira.Work closely with the IT Salesforce Center of Excellence architect and developers to ensure clear understanding of requirements.Quality AssuranceDevelop and execute test plans, test cases, and test scripts to ensure quality assurance in Salesforce applications.Conduct functional, regression, and integration testing to identify defects and ensure adherence to requirements.Collaborate with the IT Salesforce Center of Excellence architect and developers to troubleshoot issues and verify fixes.Perform usability testing to ensure user interface designs meet user needs.Document and track defects and participate in defect triage meetings.Contribute to the continuous improvement of QA processes and methodologies across client IT.Foster a collaborative and positive team environment where empathy for and responsiveness to business stakeholders is key. Required Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities:Bachelor's degree in business administration, information systems, computer science, or related field.Demonstrated experience working with Salesforce as either an administrator or developer.Proven experience (5 years or more) in business analysis and quality assurance roles.Strong business analysis skills with the ability to gather, analyze, and document business requirements related to Salesforce implementations or enhancements. Experience in conducting stakeholder interviews, workshops, and requirement prioritization.Solid understanding of quality assurance principles and methodologies, with experience in creating test plans, test cases, and executing tests within Salesforce environments. Familiarity with Salesforce-specific testing tools and processes.Knowledge of Salesforce configuration options, including custom objects, fields, workflows, validation rules, and process builder. Ability to customize Salesforce solutions to meet business requirements without code.Understanding of the Salesforce data model, data migration processes, and data integrity best practices. Experience in data cleansing, data loading, and managing data relationships within Salesforce.Familiarity with Salesforce integration patterns, APIs, and middleware platforms for integrating Salesforce with other systems such as ERP, marketing automation, or legacy systems.Ability to provide user training and support for Salesforce applications, including creating documentation, conducting training sessions, and addressing user inquiries and issues.Experience working in Agile environments, participating in Agile ceremonies such as sprint planning, daily stand-ups, sprint reviews, and retrospectives. Ability to adapt to changing requirements and priorities in iterative development cycles.Excellent communication skills with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams including business stakeholders, developers, testers, and project managers. Ability to translate technical concepts into non-technical language and vice versa.Proficiency in Jira, Confluence, GitHub, and M365 productivity software. Preferred Skills, Knowledge, and Abilities:Proficiency in wireframing tools such as Figma or similar software.Proficiency in Tableau and PowerBI.Certification in Business Analysis (e.g., CBAP) or Quality Assurance (e.g., ISTQB).Knowledge of SQL or other database querying languages.

title: Business Analyst Consultant
job_description: 2093200-2Job DescriptionThe RoleThe Business Analyst Consultant will support the Fidelity Life Insurance Company (FILI). The Consultant will collaborate with Squad Leaders, team members, and various business partners to execute on platform deliverables including, but not limited to, reporting, writing & executing test cases and supporting ad hoc requests from business partners. In addition, the Consultant will work on key initiatives aimed at driving platform resilience and optimization.In a typical week, the Consultant, who serves as a subject matter expert, will be responsible for all platform activity related to running and optimizing the business. There will also be opportunities to partner with other squads to support FILI goals and initiatives. Ultimately, this is a growth opportunity enabling the Consultant to develop their expertise and serve our customers.The Expertise And Skills You BringBachelor’s degree with 5-8 years of experience, with 1-2+ years of those within Financial ServicesFamiliarity with life insurance products, such as annuities, preferredProficiency with SQLStrong execution background with the ability to multi-task and prioritize for efficiency and business needAbility to identify application and system issues, enhancements and requests by researching platform specifications, conferring with subject matter experts across the EnterpriseThinks strategically about the end-to-end process and how platform updates may impact the Squad and the businessEvaluating, and making updates to, procedures and processes with an eye towards operational efficiencyHas experience identifying and working with data to analyze, uncover opportunities, drive fact-based decision making and measure resultsPossesses customer focus with the ability to learn, identify, and clearly communicate opportunities that will improve the experienceTranslates strategic goals and ideas into action quickly, conceptualizing, developing, and delivering strategies that meet customer needs as well as regulatory and compliance needsExhibits an Agile way of working with experience collaborating and translating business requirements into action for designers and developersAbility to build credibility and trust with diverse partners across retail and workplace and understands how to influence without authorityHas intellectually curiosity, with a continuous improvement approach, and models a culture of learning and coachingThe TeamFidelity Investments Life Insurance Company provides financial products that help Fidelity’s investors achieve the lifetime financial goals. Having our annuity and protection solutions as components in a financial plan is a strategic advantage for Personal Investing. Our annuity and protection products help ensure our clients do not outlive their assets in retirement, safeguard one’s portfolio from market volatility and protect against premature death and unforeseen long-term care costs.CertificationsCompany OverviewFidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money.Join UsAt Fidelity, you’ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples’ lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Honored with a Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, we have been recognized by our employees as a top 10 Best Place to Work in 2024. And you don’t need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning so you can build the career you’ve always imagined.Fidelity's working model blends the best of working offsite with maximizing time together in person to meet associate and business needs. Currently, most hybrid roles require associates to work onsite all business days of one assigned week per four-week period (beginning in September 2024, the requirement will be two full assigned weeks).At Fidelity, we value honesty, integrity, and the safety of our associates and customers within a heavily regulated industry. Certain roles may require candidates to go through a preliminary credit check during the screening process. Candidates who are presented with a Fidelity offer will need to go through a background investigation, detailed in this document, and may be asked to provide additional documentation as requested. This investigation includes but is not limited to a criminal, civil litigations and regulatory review, employment, education, and credit review (role dependent). These investigations will account for 7 years or more of history, depending on the role. Where permitted by federal or state law, Fidelity will also conduct a pre-employment drug screen, which will review for the following substances: Amphetamines, THC (marijuana), cocaine, opiates, phencyclidine.We invite you to Find Your Fidelity at fidelitycareers.com.Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, contact the HR Accommodation Team by sending an email to accommodations@fmr.com, or by calling 800-835-5099, prompt 2, option 3.

title: Business Analyst
job_description: Title: Business AnalystLocation: Quincy, MA (Mostly Remote)Duration: Multi Year Renewable ContractHours: 37.5 Weekly Hours Overview: We are looking to hire a Business Analyst to join our collaborative Medicaid Management Information System (MMIS) team.The Business Analyst (BA) will work on our established Member, Managed care, and/or Claims and Provider Reimbursement functional areas to support the development, testing and implementation of projects and enhancements to meet the business objectives of the MassHealth (Massachusetts Medicaid) program specifically projects to support the member community.The BA should be well versed in health plan management, operational concepts, and the systems development lifecycle.Preference will be given to candidates with Medicaid systems experience well as claims and business knowledge of the MassHealth program. The BA must have sufficient knowledge of the entire scope of the health care business to ensure that the development and testing work within their functional area is compatible with the MMIS system.The BA's primary responsibility is to ensure that the implemented coding scheme meets the requirements of the business community and conforms to all applicable Federal and state laws.The BA will be called upon to act as an active member in all phases of the project including gap analysis, requirements gathering, design and development activities, documentation, testing, implementation, and stabilization.The BA will be expected to work independently, as part of a team as well as with business stakeholders so excellent communication and documentation skills is a requirement for this job. DETAILED LIST OF JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILIITIES: Lead and participate in joint application design session with stakeholdersKnowledge of SDLC and Agile methodology a plusDevelop test strategies, test scenarios and test cases based on written requirementsExecute and review test runs and sign off on testing componentsDocument requirements and participate in their development and testingSupport the development of end-user training materials and end-user documentation as required end-user- documentation as required.Possible oversight role during the stabilization phase of each release including the monitoring of system change execution, the development of system "fix” strategies and the close monitoring of the implementation of those strategiesWork with vendors to ensure business requirements are fully defined and tested.Communicate updates and changes to impacted stakeholdersRepresent MMIS in business meetings as nProvide back up to other business analysts as needed.Data query and analysis. Preferred Qualifications: D Proficient in business analysis to support all stages of system project lifecycleCompetency in HIPAA claims and payment transaction processing C Strong data analysis skills- SQL proficient S Excellent communication and documentation skillExcellent interpersonal skills necessary to interact effectively with project managers, developers, business analysts, systems analysts, SQA analysts, business users/stakeholders, and data processing personnel; as well as interact with representatives from external agencies and companies.Demonstrated ability to work independently, as well as within project teams, providing relevant system analysis services.Highly analytical, with the ability to independently analyze, document findings and recommend solutions. Education and Certifications:• Bachelor's degree or higher with minimum 3 years' experience, or equivalent in healthcare needed• Support program staff, vendors, and other stakeholder with MMIS related questions or concerns.

title: Business Analyst
job_description: Role: BA with HIPAA EDI X12 transactions expLocation: Quincy, MA (This is a hybrid role so needs to be local in MA, RI)Duration: 12 + monthsLooking for strong HIPAA/EDI X12 healthcare related transactions including but not limited to 835, 837, 277 and 277CA.The Business Analyst will work with business users and all levels of management to interpret and translate business rules and requirements into appropriate solutions. The analyst will be responsible for translating the business needs to the Data Warehouse developers to ensure the data model, ETL specification and reports are accurately produced.Detailed List Of Job Duties And ResponsibilitiesPlans for, develops, and documents in detail the functional requirements of solutions for business problems of moderate complexity.Monitor all inbound EDI related data received from external stakeholders. Data include but are not limited to 837's, 277, NCPDP transactions.Take a proactive approach to identify and resolve file processing and data issues.Work with internal teams to support testing scenarios and issue resolution.Work with internal and external stakeholders to gather requirements and make recommendations.Investigates, designs, and implements business solutions and major upgrades or enhancements to existing solutions.Assists in complex data analysis and translates business needs into Warehouse/ Business Intelligence solutionsAssists with data training to ensure the end users of the Warehouse and the BI platform fully understand all components. Cross trains peers within subject matter areas and technical expertise area.Seeks to understand user's business activities.Participates in and occasionally leads the presentation of the results of analysis to development, users, and other analysts as necessary.Writes both business and technical documentation that is appropriate to support the development and end user community.Contributes to project plans as requested by project managers or director.Assists internal management in establishing project priorities and in allocating service delivery resources.Trains peers in the use of new tools, languages, and procedures.Experience And Education5+ years as a business analyst.A strong background working with Healthcare claims data, specifically 837 and NCPDP claimsExperience working with BI tools like Cognos or Tableau.Experience working in Business Analysis area for IT projects.Excellent documentation and analytical skills.Experience with Health Insurance and/or Medicaid.Experience with Medicaid eligibility system.Familiarity with Cloud based services like AWS servicesExperience in reading EDI 837 and NCPDP files and analyzing the data in those files.Thanks & Regards,Sagar RajuAccount ManagerTechTammina4460 Brookfield Corporate Dr,Suite N,Chantilly,VA 20151Direct: 571-685-2150 | Email: sagar.raju@tammina.comwww.TechTammina.comWeb Solutions | Mobility SolutionsMBE Certified | ISO 9001:2008 Certified

title: Business Analyst
job_description: Employment Type: Full-Time, ExperiencedDepartment: Information TechnologyCGS is looking for business analysts to work with a large federal agency! As a Business Analyst in Business operations and Content Strategy for CGS, you will partner with internal business owners and external partners to understand new business opportunities and define functional requirements.CGS brings motivated, highly skilled, and creative people together to solve the government’s most dynamic problems with cutting-edge technology. To carry out our mission, we are seeking candidates who are excited to contribute to government innovation, appreciate collaboration, and can anticipate the needs of others. Here at CGS, we offer an environment in which our employees feel supported, and we encourage professional growth through various learning opportunities.Skills and attributes for success: Support the development of briefings, agendas, and other general documentation support as directed, including training material and demonstration sessions for new and existing technologies to various stakeholders Document and analyze business and functional requirements so that they may be accurately translated into process maps and technical system requirements Develop comprehensive documentation that meets organizational standards, to include but not limited to basic system architectural diagrams/wireframes, concepts of operations, monthly status reports Create high-level briefings and communications materials for customers, management, and executive stakeholders Work with the government and team members to identify, recommend, and implement opportunities for service delivery improvement and new technology implementation Evaluate program materials and develop innovative approaches for improvement Independently gather information from subject matter experts to develop, organize, and write procedure manuals, technical specifications, and process documentation Develop and implement a deep understanding of Microsoft and Atlassian products and services (Teams, SharePoint, Visio, Jira, Confluence) to translate complex product information into simple, polished, and engaging content Research, outline, write, and edit new and existing content, working closely with various team members to understand project requirements Develop content in various media forms for maximum usability, with a consistent and cohesive voice across all documentation Perform risk management, including identifying, prioritizing, and mitigating risks, and communicating and escalating risks and issues Support a continuous improvement process by providing recommendations on improving products, services, and processes Manage client interaction and expectations regarding team efforts Identify and coordinate cross-team dependencies and collaboration Continually seek opportunities to increase customer satisfaction, develop and deepen long-lasting client relationshipsQualifications: Must be a U.S. Citizen Bachelor's Degree (Computer Science, or engineering) Must be able to successfully complete a stringent Background Investigation and obtain required Government Security clearance 7+ years of experience in business analysis, systems analysis, and/or design of information systems programs and related business processes Experience working with phase-based and Agile delivery methods Experience with Jira or other Agile tools Ability to clearly communicate technical concepts to both technical and non-technical users Must be able to work well both in a team environment and independently Must possess exceptional attention to detail Excellent interpersonal and communication skills Familiarity with government projects and policy/procedures teams Demonstrates ability to interact comfortably with Senior Leadership and/or Government Executives and staff on a day-to-day basis Experience in managing client requirements and small teams Excellent analytical skills and business presentation skillsIdeally, you will also have: Experience supporting DHS HQ or other US Federal Agencies Experience tracking and reporting project or program delivery progress and budget execution Experience developing project briefs and reports for non-technical audiences Knowledge of the federal acquisition lifecycle Familiarity with Business Intelligence and Data Analytics Project Management, Agile, and/or Cyber Certifications (PMP / ACP / CSM / SAFe / CISM)Our Commitment:Contact Government Services (CGS) strives to simplify and enhance government bureaucracy through the optimization of human, technical, and financial resources. We combine cutting-edge technology with world-class personnel to deliver customized solutions that fit our client’s specific needs. We are committed to solving the most challenging and dynamic problems.For the past seven years, we’ve been growing our government contracting portfolio, and along the way, we’ve created valuable partnerships by demonstrating a commitment to honesty, professionalism, and quality work.Here at CGS we value honesty through hard work and self-awareness, professionalism in all we do, and to deliver the best quality to our consumers mending those relations for years to come.We care about our employees. Therefore, we offer a comprehensive benefits package. Health, Dental, and Vision Life Insurance 401k Flexible Spending Account (Health, Dependent Care, and Commuter) Paid Time Off and Observance of State/Federal HolidaysContact Government Services, LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants will be considered without regard to their race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.Join our team and become part of government innovation!Explore additional job opportunities with CGS on our Job Board:https://cgsfederal.com/join-our-team/For more information about CGS please visit: https://www.cgsfederal.com or contact:Email: info@cgsfederal.com

title: Business Development Analyst
job_description: CAPITAL ADVISORS GROUP, INC.BUSINESS DEVELOPMENT ANALYSTJob Description: Capital Advisors Group, Inc. (www.capitaladvisors.com), an independent institutional investment advisor specializing in short-term, fixed-income investment management, is seeking a Business Development Analyst. The Business Development Analyst will assist in generating sales opportunities and driving revenue growth within the early-stage life science and technology markets. This role collaborates with a team of seasoned business development professionals, focusing on several key areas:Relationship Management: Work closely with the business development team to prospect new clients, maintain relationships with past clients, and onboard new clients.Sales Analytics: Responsible for reporting on sales metrics as well as developing, implementing, and evaluating sales strategies that improve processes.Database Management: Collaborate across the organization to drive business efficiency and data integrity within our client relationship management database. Sales Activities: Contribute to sales growth through strategic sales initiatives and activities.Target Market Identification: Analyze market data, trends, and competition to identify new opportunities, quantify market share, and conduct strategic assessment of competitive landscape. Additionally, this role interfaces with the Marketing Team to execute impactful campaigns to drive new sales leads. The Business Development Analyst also collaborates with the Portfolio Management team and has the chance to engage directly with clients. This exciting role provides a pathway for professionals interested in business development to thrive in an innovative and entrepreneurial setting. As the Business Development Analyst, you’ll not only attend industry events but also cultivate valuable relationships within the field. The optimal candidate will possess excellent analytical skills, strong interpersonal skills, and a keen interest in investment management and business development. This dynamic position offers a unique opportunity for growth within the investment management field along with the opportunity to make an impact as part of a collaborative and engaging team.  The Business Development Analyst position will be based in Boston, MA and will allow for hybrid work. ResponsibilitiesResponsibilities include, but are not limited to, the following: Utilizing industry standard databases to research target markets and prospects to generate warm leads;Help build and maintain the client-relationship-management (CRM) database of existing organizational relationships across clients, prospects, and third-party intermediaries;Track market activity, venture fundings, IPOs, and other capital raises within the venture-backed life science and technology markets to identify sales opportunities;Work with Sales Directors to help prepare sales presentations, conduct pre-meeting research, and assist with prospect outreach;Conduct research as needed to understand market trends and opportunities.Develop and maintain business reporting analytics; andAttend prospect meetings, industry events, and networking opportunities as appropriate. Qualifications·      Bachelor’s degree, preferably within a related field such as marketing, or finance, or economics;·      Familiarity with Salesforce, Pitchbook, and Sales Navigator is preferred;·      Excellent attention to detail and time management and organizational skills;·      Excellent written and verbal communication skills;·      The ability to successfully manage competing priorities and deadlines; and·      The ability to take initiative while working in a team environment and partnering with various internal constituents. Benefits*Capital Advisors Group offers a competitive benefits package that includes, but is not limited to, the following:·      Medical, dental, and vision insurance;·      Life insurance;·      Short-term and long-term disability insurance;·      A 401(k) plan with matching contributions;·      A health care flexible spending account plan; and·      Educational assistance.*Benefits are subject to eligibility requirements and other provisions. Capital Advisors Group is an equal opportunity employer. Tips: Provide a summary of the role, what success in the position looks like, and how this role fits into the organization overall.

title: Senior Business Analyst/Admin- Salesforce (1873175)
job_description: Senior Business Analyst/Admin- SalesforceLong Term ContractHybrid Remote/Onsite in Natick, MAThe Business Applications team provides platform, business process, and technology expertise to support our global systems, both back office and front office tools, by designing / improving business processes, managing complex implementation projects, providing user support, and training, and keeping the business application landscape up and running 24/7. In addition, the Business Applications team helps optimize the use of all business applications implemented in a cost-effective manner, to support and enhance overall success.What You Will Work On:Production support for modules within Salesforce. Work on a day-to-day basis with key business contacts to ensure any bugs found in Salesforce are fixed. Work with Salesforce development team to code items business are requesting.Project support for implementation of additional modules, integrations with Salesforce. Part of the future project team for implementing Service Cloud, Pardot, and Ecommerce will be part of this role.Help define Salesforce roadmap based on business priorities.Collaborate with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into Salesforce solutions.Create and maintain detailed documentation of Salesforce configurations, customizations, and processes.Provide training and support to end-users, ensuring they can effectively use Salesforce.Technical Support – Provided in conjunction with Sales Cloud and CPQ Delivery teams and Global IT Operations.Stay up to date with Salesforce updates, best practices, and industry trends to recommend improvements and optimizations.Continuously seek opportunities for process improvements and automation within Salesforce.Top Skills Required:Required 4-6 years of experience within SalesforceCPQ and Sales Cloud required, Service Cloud is a bonusExperience grooming Jira tickets, and maintaining ticket backlogDemand management – establishing rules and processes around gathering IT requests from business stakeholders, prioritizing, comparing against current capacity and scheduling timelines to deliverSkilled in all areas of Project and Program Management including requirements definition, process documentation, configuration and build management, test processes, change managementComfortable working with and managing vendor relationshipsAbility to understand and work within appropriate budget allocations

job_description: Vaco-Boston has partnered with our client in the investment industry looking to add a Senior Product Analyst with leadership skills to their team to support marketing and client reporting functions for their products. Document existing processes to produce product and product related data that is utilized in foundational product materials. Work with business units, affiliates, and vendors to streamline workflow Assist with planning and tactical implementation of projects . Assist with building project plans and communicate milestones regularly to key collaborators . title: IT Business Analyst, AVP
job_description: Who We Are Looking ForThe position is within the Global Technology Services/Tech Platform Engineering & Ops Mgmt. based in N. Quincy, MA. The role will report directly to the TPEO Tech Spend/DRB Mgmt. Lead and will partner in supporting the GTS Demand Review Board program, its requirements and in creating accurate, predictive and insightful reporting to support Global GTS executives with informed strategic decision making. A self-starter with critical thinking and ability to process data are crucial to being successful in the role. This is a fast paced and highly visible role dealing with time sensitive technology requirements.What You Will Be Responsible ForAs an IT Business Analyst, you willSupport the GTS DRB program and other TPEO Tech Spend initiativesDevelop relationships with GTS representatives to understand spend requirements/demand and assist in moving them through program to approvalDevelop collaborative relationships with supporting business units (Finance, GPS,OoA)Become proficient in and develop DRB Program Reporting with use of Svc NowMaintenance of program support documentation according to standard templates and providing walkthroughs of requirements with Business and Technology areasAnalysis of new tool enhancements supporting program/operational process improvements and understand in detail the impact they have on business requirements and program functionEscalation of risks and issues and Ad-hoc Problem SolvingProject management of small initiatives may be required from time to timeWhat We ValueThese skills will help you succeed in this roleHighly analytical and detail-oriented – demonstrate ability to ensure accuracy of reports/models and impactful insights for presenting to senior management; be able to synthesize concise and meaningful results through working with large databasesExcellent written and verbal communication, presentation and problem-solving skillsAbility to ask right questions and ability to interpret and present gathered informationGood internal and external stakeholder relationship management skillsAbility to work as an individual contributor as well as in a team environmentProactive approach to problem solving, taking ownership of issues and follow throughEducation & Qualifications3+ years of experience within Financial Planning & Analysis, Financial Services experienceAdvanced knowledge of MS Office: (Excel, Word, Power Point, Visio – PowerBI & Tableau a plus)Knowledge of process modelingWhy this role is important to usOur technology function, Global Technology Services (GTS), is vital to State Street and is the key enabler for our business to deliver data and insights to our clients. We’re driving the company’s digital transformation and expanding business capabilities using industry best practices and advanced technologies such as cloud, artificial intelligence and robotics process automation.We offer a collaborative environment where technology skills and innovation are valued in a global organization. We’re looking for top technical talent to join our team and deliver creative technology solutions that help us become an end-to-end, next-generation financial services company.Join us if you want to grow your technical skills, solve real problems and make your mark on our industry.Salary Range$80,000 - $132,500 AnnualThe range quoted above applies to the role in the primary location specified. If the candidate would ultimately work outside of the primary location above, the applicable range could differ.Job ID: R-747847
Industries: Financial Services, Investment Banking, and Investment Management

title: Business Analyst, GlobalLink Digital - VP
job_description: Business Analyst, GlobalLink DigitalWho We Are Looking ForResponsible for working with GlobalLink & Global Markets stakeholders to build out GL Pay product within GlobalLink Digital. Manage GL Pay work streams coordination with business units, individual product team SMEs, development, quality assurance, external clients and core corporate functions on a daily basis.Why This Role Is Important To UsThe team you will be joining is a part of State Street Global Markets (SSGM). When owners and managers of institutional assets need research, trading, securities lending and innovative portfolio strategies, they turn to SSGM business unit. As our onboarding and operations service partner, the COO has embarked on a transformational effort to add low-code automation tools to drive optimization of our processes and service levels.Join us if making your mark in the financial services industry from day one is a challenge you are up for.What You Will Be Responsible ForWork with GlobalLink & Global Markets product managers, business SMEs, clients and other stakeholders to create detailed business requirements and define functional requirements including constructing client solutions, workflow charts, report specifications, diagrams and screen mockups.Work closely with the development and QA teams to ensure timelines are clear to all parties. Build out shared strategy, design, development, business specifications and release meetings.Administration of system documentation including product development schedules, release schedules, bug tracking, etc. Monitor project progress by tracking activity, resolving problems, publishing progress reports, and recommending actions.Communicate and collaborate effectively with many different team members across the business and technology areas. Facilitate and perform reviews of the project plan to ensure key timelines are sufficiently met and that there is consistency in the communication to project partners and senior managers.Ensuring that when features are delivered they meet the requirements.What We ValueDisplay a culture of individual ownership of tasks to embed a clear individual sense of accountability in performing the roleEnsure that the highest level of the Code of Conduct is displayed in your behaviourProvide appropriate management information as required to support business unit decision makingSupport the ‘Risk Excellence’ culture within the businessAdhere to limits of delegation and escalation procedures required by your manager so that you comply with internal policies and external regulationsEducation & Preferred QualificationsDemonstrated excellent written and oral communication skillsStrong communication skillsDirect experience in the electronic trading of financial instruments, including but not limited to corporate FX, FX workflow, settlements, Swift messaging and settlement instructions.7+ years of business analysis, project management or product management experienceAdvanced skills with MS Office suite (including Excel, PowerPoint, Visio) and Atlassian suite (JIRA, Confluence)Knowledge and understanding of trading transfer protocols including FIX, SWIFT and experience in implementing API-based solutionsExcellent prioritization and resource management skills.Demonstrated skill driving results with imperfect information.Strong communication, organization and interpersonal skills.Financial services industry experience. Specifically, with electronic trading of FX and post-trade settlements.Electronic Trading System Workflow and User Experience design experience a plus.Detail oriented and self-motivated.About State StreetWhat we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation, we’re making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we’ve been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary by location, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans, among other perks. You’ll have access to flexible Work Programs to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees’ diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. If the candidate would ultimately work outside of the primary location above, the applicable range could differ.Job ID: R-747457

title: Generative AI Business and Technology Analyst
job_description: This is a remote position.About UsAI is the future of the enterprise, and generative AI is the wave that will bring the biggest productivity gains in generations. We are a team of deeply experienced leaders from a variety of companies such as Cloud Technology Partners (HPE), Microsoft, Cisco, Databricks, Manifold, Productive AI, and more. We are a premier solutions and services firm for enterprises looking to gain scale and competitive advantage through Microsoft Copilot and AI platforms adoption.Our Services IncludeAITP leads our client’s Generative Enterprise journey.We extend our client’s Microsoft Copilot environments and build custom Copilot solutions that integrate with systems.Provide end-to-end services to accelerate our client’s generative AI transformation and Microsoft Copilot adoption.The RoleRoleWe are looking for a Generative AI Business and Technology Analyst to join our US-based team. In this role, we will rely on your combined expertise in analyzing business processes and technologies, communicating with stakeholders, providing recommendations to improve business performance, and implementing new technologies. You will work directly with our clients to: Develop and demo Generative AI solutions Design tailored solutions and oversee their development and integration QA testing and ongoing support and maintenance Monitoring performance and effectiveness, implementing feedback loops for improvementRequirements3-5 year’s experience in professional services at a consulting firm with an emphasis on understanding and analyzing business processesAnalytical and Business Analysis skillsPassion for (and experience with) generative AI tools such as ChatGPT, Claude, Midjourney and other such toolsExperience in creating and implementing prompt-driven workflows in Gen AI models; building complex prompts / prompt flows and sequences that accelerate business processesGeneral technical aptitude and fast learnerPreferredGo To Market / Marketing / Sales domain experienceGeneral understanding of cloud concepts and platforms such as Azure, AWS, or Google CloudExperience in project management, data analysis, and software developmentAbility to travel on a limited basis (no more than 20%) for client engagementsBenefitsWhat We OfferA place to Grow Your Career with opportunities to work on the most interesting, challenging, and innovative client projects.A place where Everyone Belongs, and you are encouraged to bring your whole self to work.A place of Learning & Sharing where we are passionate about growing our knowledge and sharing our expertise with others.A place of Flexibility to live where you feel the most at home and inspired.AI Technology Partners is committed to a policy of equal employment opportunity in all its employment practices and thus reaffirms that there shall be no unlawful discrimination against any employee or applicant for employment on the grounds of race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, handicapped or disabled status, or veteran status.

title: Strategy Analyst
job_description: OverviewWe are seeking a Strategy Analyst who flourishes with analyzing complex business challenges and formulating strategic solutions. As a Strategy Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in crafting our organization’s direction by providing data-driven insights, competitive analysis, and actionable recommendations. If you have a passion for dissecting market trends, evaluating competitive landscapes, and supplying to strategic decision-making, this role is for you.Responsibilities Conduct detailed research and analysis of industry trends, sales trends, market dynamics, and competitive intelligence.  Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify growth opportunities, assess risks, and develop strategic initiatives.  Build financial models, scenario analyses, and business cases to evaluate potential investments and strategic moves.  Supervise key performance indicators (KPIs) and track progress against strategic goals.  Prepare executive-level presentations and reports to communicate findings and recommendations.  Assist in the development and execution of strategic plans, including mergers, acquisitions, and partnerships.  Stay abreast of new technologies, regulatory changes, and disruptive forces that impact our industry. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in a scientific, business, or economics related field  2-4 years of experience in strategy consulting, corporate strategy, data analytics or related roles.  Proficiency in data analysis tools (Excel, SQL, SAP etc.) and business intelligence platforms.  Strong analytical mentality, attention to detail, and ability to synthesize complex information.  Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.  Critical thinking and problem-solving abilities.  Familiarity with Liquid Chromatography or Mass Spectrometry is a plus Company DescriptionWaters Corporation (NYSE: WAT), the world's leading specialty measurement company, has pioneered chromatography, mass spectrometry and thermal analysis innovations serving the life, materials, and food sciences for over 60 years. With approximately 8,000 employees worldwide, Waters operates directly in 35 countries, including 15 manufacturing facilities, with products available in more than 100 countries. Our team focuses on creating business advantages for laboratory-dependent organizations to enable significant advancement in healthcare delivery, environmental management, food safety, and water quality.Working at Waters enables our employees to unlock the potential of their careers. Our global team is driven by purpose. We strive to be better, learn and improve every day in everything we do. We’re the problem solvers and innovators that aren’t afraid to take risks to transform the world of human health and well-being. We’re all in it together delivering benefit as one to provide the insights needed today in order to solve the challenges of tomorrow.Diversity and inclusion are fundamental to our core values at Waters Corporation. It is our responsibility to actively implement programs and practices to drive inclusive behavior and increase diversity across the organization. We are united by diversity and thrive on it for the benefit of our employees, our products, our customers and our community. Waters is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace and is an affirmative action employer. We are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, marital status, disability, gender identity or protected Veteran status. Key Words Strategy, analysis, competitive intelligence, financial modeling, KPIs, strategic planning.

title: Senior Business Analyst, Customer Solutions
job_description: 2093660-3Job DescriptionThe RoleAre you interested in serving the needs of millions of customers at Fidelity's Workplace Investing, by building the best-in-class digital experience that helps them in financial planning, investing, and retirement solutions?As a Senior Business Analyst in Fidelity’s Workplace Investing Customer Solutions Chapter, you will be a member of an Agile squad responsible for crafting an engaging experience for our clients. Day to day, you will work closely with a team of cross functional and dedicated squad members (product, technology, legal, compliance & risk partners) responsible for delivering specific business goals.In this role, you will work with your squad to provide effective product partnership through communication, risk mitigation, quality assurance, effective delivery and build strong working relationships across the organization. As a Senior Business Analyst, you must be a highly motivated self-starter with a sense of ownership, attention to detail, and be an effective liaison between stakeholders and your team.The Expertise And Skills You BringIdentify and document business requirements, current and future states, and provide constructive feedback for future process improvementsExperience with workflow design, data analysis, data visualization, and impact analysisFamiliar with the Agile methodology concept and experience in agile tools such as Jira, Confluence, Mural or similar Agile backlog management tools (training is available)Define epics, user stories, acceptance criteria, facilitate story grooming/refinement sessions, and demo sprint deliverablesLead the daily Scrums, Sprint Planning Meetings, Release Planning, Sprint Reviews and RetrospectivesPerform end to end Business Acceptance Testing and ensure the traceability of test casesYou take initiative to communicate issues/client feedback with Squad Leader/team and resolve issues in a timely mannerStrong written and verbal communication skills, including the ability to summarize and interpret information to influence key stakeholders such as Subject Matter Experts, and Business PartnersManage dependencies across teams and work on multiple projects simultaneouslyProven leadership by mentoring peers and showcase critical thinking by managing conflicts within teams5-7 years transferable experienceBachelor’s degree preferredThe TeamWI Customer Solutions provides the WI Agile organization with business analysts and consultants. The Customer Solutions team is responsible for helping the business achieve results. Our role is to turn business objectives into useful plans and solutions that deliver outstanding customer value.CertificationsCompany OverviewFidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money.Join UsAt Fidelity, you’ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples’ lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Honored with a Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, we have been recognized by our employees as a top 10 Best Place to Work in 2024. And you don’t need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning so you can build the career you’ve always imagined.Fidelity's working model blends the best of working offsite with maximizing time together in person to meet associate and business needs. Currently, most hybrid roles require associates to work onsite all business days of one assigned week per four-week period (beginning in September 2024, the requirement will be two full assigned weeks).At Fidelity, we value honesty, integrity, and the safety of our associates and customers within a heavily regulated industry. Certain roles may require candidates to go through a preliminary credit check during the screening process. Candidates who are presented with a Fidelity offer will need to go through a background investigation, detailed in this document, and may be asked to provide additional documentation as requested. This investigation includes but is not limited to a criminal, civil litigations and regulatory review, employment, education, and credit review (role dependent). These investigations will account for 7 years or more of history, depending on the role. Where permitted by federal or state law, Fidelity will also conduct a pre-employment drug screen, which will review for the following substances: Amphetamines, THC (marijuana), cocaine, opiates, phencyclidine.We invite you to Find Your Fidelity at fidelitycareers.com.Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, contact the HR Accommodation Team by sending an email to accommodations@fmr.com, or by calling 800-835-5099, prompt 2, option 3.

Bloomberg (Point/Port).Exposure to project management/project management skills is a plus.#MBLIAt MFS, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace. title: Senior Supply Chain Analyst
job_description: *Position requires three days in office per week*Our Productivity Team is responsible for delivering productivity savings year over year across all of Supply Chain (Procurement, Logistics, and Manufacturing). This position will lead a productivity tower along with all Planview maintenance required to track, update, and manage all productivity projects within the tower. In this role, you will be responsible for tracking performance, evaluating risks and opportunities, facilitating tower meetings, providing a cadence for updates, and driving project completion. This position serves as a liaison between key stakeholders across the towers and supply chain leadership. What you will do:Responsible for analysis across projects, reporting, risk assessment, and tower performanceBring together stakeholders for decision-making, review, and direction on major initiatives. Build a cadence for the tower leaders to review, report, and update project performanceBecome a Subject Matter Expert in Planview Database (system of record for productivity reporting)Pulling down data sets out of Planview and working with formulas and pivot tables to report on tower statusWork with PM’s to support their calculation methodology and help solve questions about how they will calculate actuals at months end Work with financial counterpart to understand the portion of productivity that is built into the AOP – be able to work with data to ensure a consistent match between AOP and PlanviewSupport Ad-Hoc Requests for project updates, analysis, and executive level presentationsWork with project leaders to ensure we have updated forecasts, appropriate stage gates, alignment on calculation methodologies, and reporting period actualsWork with Tower Leads on Best PracticesAbility to work with project leads, finance leads, tower sponsors, and other Supply Chain LeadershipResponsible for effectively reporting productivity results that align to our finance P&L reports.Requirements:Bachelor’s degree in supply chain management, mathematics, engineering, business, or related field required; Master’s degree in business, operations research, or related field preferred.5+ years of experience in a related role.Extensive experience with Microsoft Power Point & Excel including other Microsoft suite products.Flexible and able to work in a rapidly changing environment.Ability to push forward on projects, even when all of the requirements have not been defined.Detailed and deadline-orientated to meet regular and periodic needs of the business for accurate and timely information.Strong capability to thoroughly review and sense-check results so that analysis is right the first time.Must be able to create a professional presentation of results, including determining results-first or results-last approaches, ability to construct results that “tell a story”, and ability to lead an audience to the proper conclusions or decisions relevant to the situation.Expert analytical capabilities including advanced knowledge of Excel and demonstrated competence with data Ability to proactively engage with the tower leaders and influence key decisions with factKeurig Dr Pepper (NASDAQ: KDP) is a modern beverage company with a bold vision built to deliver growth and opportunity. We operate with a differentiated business model and world-class brand portfolio, powered by a talented and engaged team that is anchored in our values. We work with big, exciting beverage brands and the #1 single-serve coffee brewing system in North America at KDP, and we have fun doing it!  Together, we have built a leading beverage company in North America offering hot and cold beverages together at scale. Whatever your area of expertise, at KDP you can be a part of a team that’s proud of its brands, partnerships, innovation, and growth. Will you join us?  We strive to be an employer of choice, providing a culture and opportunities that empower our team of ~28,000 employees to grow and develop. We offer robust benefits to support your health and wellness as well as your personal and financial well-being. We also provide employee programs designed to enhance your professional growth and development, while ensuring you feel valued, inspired and appreciated at work. title: Senior Business and Data Analyst, External Relations (64394BR)
job_description: Position DescriptionData Analysis and Interpretation: Perform in-depth analysis of complex data sets, including financial, operational, and customer data. Use statistical methods and data visualization techniques to identify trends, patterns, and correlations that can provide valuable insights to support strategic decision-making. Requirements Gathering: Collaborate with stakeholders from different departments to understand their business objectives and requirements. Translate business needs into data analysis requirements and develop analytical models to address specific business questions or problems. Reporting and Presentations: Create clear and concise reports, dashboards, and presentations to communicate findings and recommendations to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. Present complex data and analysis results in a visually compelling and easy-to-understand manner. Insights and Recommendations: Analyze data and identify opportunities for process improvement, cost reduction, revenue growth, and enhanced customer experience. Provide actionable recommendations based on data-driven insights to support business strategies and objectives. Data Visualization: Utilize data visualization tools to create interactive and intuitive visual representations of data, enabling stakeholders to explore and understand complex information more effectively. Cross-Functional Collaboration: Collaborate with cross-functional teams, including business stakeholders, IT professionals, and data engineers, to ensure smooth data integration, implementation of analytical solutions, and alignment with business goals. Continuous Learning and Development: Stay up to date with industry trends, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analysis, business intelligence, and data visualization. Continuously enhance skills and knowledge through self-learning, training, and professional development opportunities. Ability to perform the essential duties of the position with or without reasonable accommodation. This role is responsible for other duties as assigned. Basic QualificationsMinimum of five years’ post-secondary education or relevant work experienceAdditional Qualifications And SkillsOther Required Qualifications:Bachelor's or Master's degree in Business Administration, Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field. Other Qualifications: Experience as a Business Analyst, Data Analyst, or similar role, preferably with a focus on data analysis and business intelligence. Strong analytical skills and proficiency in statistical analysis tools and techniques. Proficiency in data analysis and visualization tools such as SQL, Python, R, Tableau, Power BI, Oracle Analytics or similar. Good understanding of data governance principles, data management, and data quality assurance. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data analysis into actionable insights for non-technical stakeholders. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and strategically. Experience in time management and the ability to manage multiple tasks concurrently. Strong attention to detail and ability to work with large datasets. Additional InformationThis role is offered as a hybrid (some combination of onsite and remote) where you will be required to be onsite at our Boston, MA based campus 2 days per week. Specific days and schedule will be determined between you and your manager.We may conduct candidate interviews virtually (phone and/or via Zoom) and/or in-person for this role.A cover letter is required to be considered for this opportunity.Harvard Business School will not offer visa sponsorship for this opportunity.Culture of Inclusion: The work and well-being of HBS is profoundly strengthened by the diversity of our network and our differences in background, culture, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, and life experiences. Explore more about HBS work culture here https://www.hbs.edu/employment .About UsHarvard Business School’s department of External Relations (ER) is a place where innovation and record-breaking results are the norm. The technology that enables these accomplishments is essential to the success of the organization. We have a large and complex technology portfolio with integrations between a website, mobile app, numerous applications, and databases. We have an experienced team of data professionals who have invested years in building the foundation of our technology portfolio.The ER Business Intelligence team collaborates with business stakeholders to understand their needs, objectives, and challenges. We proactively engage with departments and teams to identify opportunities for leveraging data-driven decision-making. We apply predictive analytics techniques to forecast future trends, identify potential risks or opportunities, and support strategic planning. The BI team designs intuitive and visually appealing dashboards and reports that present complex data in an easily understandable manner. It is the BI team’s responsibilities to stay informed about emerging trends and technologies in the BI field and evaluate their potential impact on the organization.We are seeking a highly analytical and detail-oriented individual with creative and critical thinking, excellent problem-solving skills, experience with in-depth analysis of complex data sets, and solid background in various technologies to join our team as a Senior Business and Data Analyst. Senior Business and Data Analyst is a key role within an organization that combines business acumen with data analysis skills to drive informed decision-making and support business objectives. This position involves working closely with various stakeholders to gather and analyze data, identify trends, and provide actionable insights. The Senior Business and Data Analyst is responsible for leveraging data to solve complex business problems, improve operational efficiency, and enhance overall performance.BenefitsWe invite you to visit Harvard's Total Rewards website ( https://hr.harvard.edu/totalrewards ) to learn more about our outstanding benefits package, which may include:Paid Time Off: 3-4 weeks of accrued vacation time per year (3 weeks for support staff and 4 weeks for administrative/professional staff), 12 accrued sick days per year, 12.5 holidays plus a Winter Recess in December/January, 3 personal days per year (prorated based on date of hire), and up to 12 weeks of paid leave for new parents who are primary care givers. Health and Welfare: Comprehensive medical, dental, and vision benefits, disability and life insurance programs, along with voluntary benefits. Most coverage begins as of your start date.  Work/Life and Wellness: Child and elder/adult care resources including on campus childcare centers, Employee Assistance Program, and wellness programs related to stress management, nutrition, meditation, and more. Retirement: University-funded retirement plan with contributions from 5% to 15% of eligible compensation, based on age and earnings with full vesting after 3 years of service. Tuition Assistance Program: Competitive program including $40 per class at the Harvard Extension School and reduced tuition through other participating Harvard graduate schools. Tuition Reimbursement: Program that provides 75% to 90% reimbursement up to $5,250 per calendar year for eligible courses taken at other accredited institutions.  Professional Development: Programs and classes at little or no cost, including through the Harvard Center for Workplace Development and LinkedIn Learning. Commuting and Transportation: Various commuter options handled through the Parking Office, including discounted parking, half-priced public transportation passes and pre-tax transit passes, biking benefits, and more.  Harvard Facilities Access, Discounts and Perks: Access to Harvard athletic and fitness facilities, libraries, campus events, credit union, and more, as well as discounts to various types of services (legal, financial, etc.) and cultural and leisure activities throughout metro-Boston. title: State Street Global Advisors - Sr. Business Analyst, AVP - Next Gen Client Reporting
job_description: Who we are looking for A motivated Senior Business Analyst with financial and technical experience to lead requirement gathering and data analysis on Investment Data Domains supporting a centralized Enterprise Data Hub platform on AWS. Candidate should have from 5+ years of experience working in the asset management industry, participate in discussion with the portfolio managers on requirements gathering and data analysis, and partner with development team to translate the requirements into implementation task. The individual will be Boston-based and will work with portfolio managers and operations staff from Boston, EMEA, and APAC regions. This role can be performed in a hybrid model, where you can balance work from home and office to match your needs and role requirements, however at least 4 days a week onsite are expected. As an Business Analyst you will Partner with business stakeholders to capture the requirements and create examples to illustrate understandings and challenges. Conduct data analysis required to support the requirements; review specification with business stakeholders, and obtain approval for development. Participate in large scale data warehousing, data lake projects Collaborate with wider global teams on key business initiatives Actively working with development team to facilitate the technical design, create system specification and agile stories. Lead story grooming, provide subsequent clarifications, and approve QA test cases. Assist in test case development, review, execution of part of test cases and support all stakeholders during testing activities, These skills will help you succeed in this role Database experience with SQL or other database languages. Asset management experience, especially in the area of investment data domains, market data, holdings, transactions, performance & attribution to support client reporting. Highly organized, self-motivated and the ability to work on multiple related initiatives. Education & Preferred Qualifications 5+ years of past experience implementing technology solutions with asset management firm(s) Prior experience in data warehousing, data analytics to support enterprise data consumption is preferred Excellent communication skills and confidence in dealing with all levels of the organization, both internal and external Solid presentation and writing skills Bachelor's degree in finance, accounting, economics, business administration, computer science or related field Qualified bachelor degree or higher CFA is preferred. Are you the right candidate? Yes! We truly believe in the power that comes from the diverse backgrounds and experiences our employees bring with them. Although each vacancy details what we are looking for, we don't necessarily need you to fulfil all of them when applying. If you like change and innovation, seek to see the bigger picture, make data driven decisions and are a good team player, you could be a great fit. About State Street Global Advisors What We Do. As the asset management arm of State Street Corporation, State Street Global Advisors has served the world's governments, institutions and financial advisors for over four decades. With a rigorous, risk-aware approach built on research, analysis and market-tested experience, we build from a breadth of active and index strategies to create cost-effective solutions. As stewards, we help portfolio companies see that what is fair for people and sustainable for the planet can deliver long-term performance. And, as pioneers in index, ETF, and ESG investing, we are always inventing new ways to invest. As a result, we have become one of the world's largest asset managers with trillions of dollars under our care. Our Mission. At State Street Global Advisors our mission is to invest responsibly to enable economic prosperity and social progress. We are driven by a desire to help our clients, and those who rely on them, achieve a better future. We have a long history of developing innovative investment strategies to provide our clients with reliable and transparent returns, cost-effectively, and without excessive risk. Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary by location, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans, among other perks. You'll have access to Flexible Work Programs to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential. Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees' diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift programs and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you. State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. Company: State Street Global Advisors Salary Range: $90,000 - $142,500 Annual The range quoted above applies to the role in the primary location specified. If the candidate would ultimately work outside of the primary location above, the applicable range could differ.

title: Amazon Marketplace Specialist
job_description: Company DescriptionJDE USA, headquartered in Maynard, MA, is a fast-growing premium consumer packaged goods company that is a standalone subsidiary of JDE Peet’s, the largest pure-play coffee and tea company globally. JDE Peet’s business is fueled by a supply chain reaching more than 100 countries, unleashing the possibilities of coffee & tea through their strong portfolio of global, regional and local brands. These brands are built upon a rich history and heritage deeply rooted in the diverse coffee & tea cultures in which we work. The JDE Peet’s portfolio supplies coffee and tea to everyone, no matter who they are, where they are, or what their preferences are. JDE USA offers Tea Forté globally and L’OR Coffee in the U.S.Job DescriptionJDE USA is seeking to expand their team with an Amazon Marketplace Specialist role. This position is responsible for the day-to-day operation and analysis of the Amazon business and will work closely with Operations, Marketing, Finance, and Customer Experience. This individual should be a proven analyst with experience in Ecommerce. This self-motivated individual will be driven to understand the business and find new opportunities in the channel for growth.ResponsibilitiesSupport the day-to-day operations including product content, inventory availability, pricing and promotional activities in order to optimize conversion and revenue.Monitor Merchant Fulfilled orders for potential problems between Amazon’s system and our internal operations system. Ensure timely fulfillment of these orders by our third-party warehouse.Ensure proper inventory levels. Work with Operations to coordinate PO’s and shipments to Amazon by analyzing and projecting demand.Gather daily sales, inventory, advertising, and pricing reports for all Amazon countries/brands.Perform site audits to maintain consistent Buy Box, content, and imagery across all items.Coordinate new product setup including production of copy, imagery, keywords, attributes, and other product data.Coordinate with Customer Experience team to provide best in class experience and maintain and improve on 98%+ seller rating.Provide supporting data to Product Development and Marketing departments to assist in delivering new products for brand appropriate opportunities on Amazon.Remediate listing, trademark, and other seller issues to maintain the integrity of Tea Forte on Amazon.Handle the content flow of items during scheduled item launch cycles.Collaborate with Product Management team on feedback needed to analyze the success of new product launches and line expansion opportunities.QualificationsProven analyst with solid understanding of what drives an online business.3-5 years’ experience in Amazon 3rd party (Seller Central) and direct to consumer in a brand setting.Curiosity for how things work- to test, improve results and apply learnings where possible.Excellent data analysis skills and business acumen to turn analysis into insights and recommendations.Proficiency with Microsoft Excel desired.Professional maturity to bring issues and solutions to management.Ability to multi-task in a fast-paced, entrepreneurial environment. Upbeat and positive attitude.Strong interpersonal and collaboration skills.
