title: Business Systems Analyst (Real Estate/Yardi)-Hybrid/Boston - 24119
job_description: Business Systems Analyst with Real Estate Portfolio Management and Accounting SystemsAbout the Role:NO C2C CANDIDATES WILL BE CONSIDERED.Join a dynamic team supporting Private and Strategic Investments within a renowned investment firm's Real Estate sector in Boston, MA. As a Business Analyst and Real Estate Technology Specialist, you'll be at the forefront of technology-driven initiatives, from conception to execution. Armed with a deep understanding of business processes, you'll translate requirements into technical specifications, guide system implementations, and ensure seamless user acceptance testing.Responsibilities:Cultivate robust relationships with stakeholders, bridging the gap between business needs and technical solutions. Elicit, validate, and document business requirements for technology initiatives, encompassing data flows, modeling, and user interface designs. Lead system planning and testing efforts, ensuring alignment with business objectives. Drive user acceptance testing and provide support for system training and documentation. Simultaneously manage production support tasks and application development projects, maintaining high standards of quality and efficiency. Develop and maintain comprehensive documentation to support technology requests and implementations. Required Technology Experience:Proficiency with Yardi Modules (Voyager/Construction Manager, P2P Investor Accounting) or similar real estate portfolio management and accounting systems. Strong familiarity with reporting and data visualization tools, particularly Power BI. Intermediate skills in data modeling, normalization, and SQL queries. Expertise in managing business requirements throughout the development lifecycle. Ability to develop workflow and functional Use Cases, ensuring alignment with business processes. Prior development experience is a plus. Qualifications:Bachelor's or advanced degree in computer science, systems, or finance. Master's degree with a concentration in finance, technology, or analytics preferred. 6+ years of relevant experience, with at least 2 years in real estate or alternative investments systems is required. Strong interpersonal skills, fostering collaboration and teamwork. Exceptional facilitation and organization skills, adept at managing complex projects. Excellent written and verbal communication skills, ensuring clear and effective communication across all levels of the organization. Please note: We cannot accept any candidates that are C2C so please save me from flooding my inbox to ask if this can be C2C. Candidates must be in the Boston, MA area to be considered. If interested please send your resume to Angela Fagin at afagin@daleyaa.com

title: Senior Knowledge Analyst - Change Management
job_description: WHAT YOU'LL DO As a Senior Knowledge Analyst (SKA) In a Client Focused role inside BCG's People and Organization (POP) Practice Area with a focus on Culture and Change Management, you will work in a growing global team, delivering value to clients via individual expertise and/or institutionalized knowledge assets (products, tools, data, workshops, frameworks, surveys, domain-specific data and related expertise, etc.). You will contribute on cases and proposals by contributing relevant analysis and insights and help case teams create strong impact for the client. While contributing to client cases, workshops and proposals, occasional travel to serve clients onsite during staffing assignments is expected to understand client requirements, and design / develop solutions. You will support commercialization efforts for the topic/sector working, in conjunction with business leaders, through contributing analysis and insights to proposals, client workshops and marketing materials. Additionally, as a Senior Knowledge Analyst, you will contribute to developing intellectual property & assets for the business and assist in onboarding and training junior colleagues based on your topic/sector expertise. In the People and Organization Practice Area, we focus on Organization Design & Operating Model, Talent and Skills, and Culture and Change Management. Within Culture and Change, we assist clients to deliver sustainable value creation and build adoption across organizational leaders, employees, and programs by influencing the right behaviors and mindsets for success. As a Senior Knowledge Analyst, you will support across all domains, with a specific focus on purpose-driven culture change and transformation management. YOU'RE GOOD ATSolving client problems through formulating and presenting relevant research and/or analytical approaches in change management, culture, or business transformationManaging and successfully delivering many initiatives with multiple milestones in a client settingBuilding client-ready deliverables In Microsoft PowerPoint, Excel, and WordCommunicating with senior stakeholders, in a credible and confident wayCollecting, synthesizing, and analyzing case team learnings and outputs to develop new proprietary knowledge assetsWorking collaboratively and effectively in a group dynamic often virtual, proficient in agile ways of workingFlexibility and bringing a curious and creative mindset, open to new things and able to propose innovative ideasAbility to navigate complexity and ambiguity, independently managing work products to meet agreed upon deadlines and expectations YOU BRING (EXPERIENCE & QUALIFICATIONS)1-2+ years of consulting experience in change management, culture transformation, or program management required; candidates with consulting experience strongly preferredIn lieu of consulting experience, 2+ years minimum industry experience required; 3-6+ years of industry experience strongly preferredBachelor's Degree required (advanced degree preferred)Fluency in EnglishStrong business acumen and problem-solving capabilitiesStrong written and verbal communication skills YOU'LL WORK WITH As a Client Focus KT, you will work face to face with clients and with BCG Project Leaders, Associates and Consultants. In the period between cases, you will collaborate with global topic leads and colleagues across BCG to bring expertise and capabilities to the service of our internal and external clients. Our team is made up a diverse pool of knowledge positions that allow us to pursue exciting, innovative knowledge careers. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION The Knowledge Team (KT) is a group of functional and/or industry experts leveraging deep domain knowledge to enable insight for case teams and clients. KT members are affiliated to BCG Practice Areas, plugged into the strategic agenda and building and deploying leading edge IP data tools/assets to deliver insight. BCG's Knowledge Team members are staffed on cases and help co-create insights with case teams and clients through expert perspectives on industry trends, delivery of proprietary data or tools in a particular function and complex research and analysis of market information. KT members also support the PA’s business development and proposals and help to organize and codify the knowledge that enables BCG to deliver superior business value for its clients. Total compensation for this role includes base salary, annual discretionary performance bonus, contributions to BCG’s Profit Sharing and Retirement Fund (PSRF), and a market leading benefits package described below. Some local governments in the United States require job postings to include a reasonable estimate of base compensation. We expect your total annualized compensation to be approximately the following:In New York City the base salary is between $114,000 - $121,400 (USD); placement within this range will vary based on experience and skill levelIn other locations, competitive pay is commensurate with the role and geographyAnnual discretionary performance bonus between 0-24%5% Profit Sharing Retirement Fund (PSRF) contribution, increasing to 10% after two years of service. Contributions are vested immediately and there is no waiting period. All of our plans provide best in class coverage:Zero dollar ($0) health insurance premiums for BCG employees, spouses, and childrenLow $10 (USD) copays for trips to the doctor, urgent care visits and prescriptions for generic drugsDental coverage, including up to $5,000 in orthodontia benefitsVision insurance with coverage for both glasses and contact lenses annuallyReimbursement for gym memberships and other fitness activitiesFully vested Profit Sharing Retirement Fund contributions made annually, whether you contribute or not, plus the option for employees to make personal contributions to a 401(k) planPaid Parental Leave and other family benefits such as elective egg freezing, surrogacy, and adoption reimbursementGenerous paid time off including 12 holidays per year, an annual office closure between Christmas and New Years, and 15 vacation days per year (earned at 1.25 days per month)Paid sick time on an as needed basis *Employees, spouses, and children are covered at no cost. Employees share in the cost of domestic partner coverage. #cf #bcgcareers #bcglife

title: Analyst HR Reporting Design
job_description: Address: USA-MA-Quincy-1385 Hancock StreetStore Code: Workforce Systems (5135622)Ahold Delhaize USA, a division of global food retailer Ahold Delhaize, is part of the U.S. family of brands, which also includes five leading omnichannel grocery brands – Food Lion, Giant Food, The GIANT Company, Hannaford and Stop & Shop. Ahold Delhaize USA associates support the brands with a wide range of services, including Finance, Legal, Sustainability, Commercial, Digital and E-commerce, Technology and more.Primary Purpose:The primary purpose of this role is SME level knowledge, governance, and execution of all changes and project work for all US HR Systems (including cloud-based apps and on-premises solutions) supporting Ahold Delhaize’s US Associate population of over 200,000 active associates. Includes in-depth understanding of the business processes end to end as well as working understanding of all core HR systems and upstream/downstream impacts. The HRIS Delivery Analyst is responsible for SuccessFactors US Configuration, Mass Data Changes, US Foundation Data, and overall data Integrity as well as ensuring all systems are operating effectively. This role develops strategies to execute changes required to support Business Services and our Brands, it also configures, implements, analyzes, maintains, monitors and modifies existing HR Systems, including cloud-based systems and on-premises systems to support HR operations. Responsible for the day-to-day operation of HR systems, implementing changes, and monitoring oversight of data, coordination, and evaluation of all data within the SuccessFactors Biz X Suite. This role will provide business support for one or more applications relating to HR, and other key 3rd party applications that impact HR data. This role uses HR systems, configuration, and data model expertise to support Brand effectiveness. Partners with the Operations team to improve HR execution and overall HR data integrity processes with a focus on effectiveness and efficiency. Serves as HRIS Subject Matter Expert for business customers.This position will be accountable for delivery of US SuccessFactors configuration, foundation objects, mass data changes, and data integrity management. This role also serves as a US Technical Delivery Subject Matter Expert, providing technical delivery support for all SuccessFactors modules. Serves as HRIS Subject Matter Expert for Business Services Analysts, Specialists, Brand customers, and technical partners.Principle Duties and Responsibilities:Leads the management, monitoring, and improvement of existing and new Delivery management and IT processes such as change management, release management, resource planning, and issue resolution. Works on analyzing, customizing, modifying, and implementing complex processes and support applications.Designs, leads, provides functional subject matter expertise for installation, customization and usage of applications.Identifies process weaknesses in the use of the application and partners with the Design team to develop changes in design or tuning and then implements them.Manages and supports IT infrastructure linkages, software development connections and implementation, business requirements being translated into functional and technical specifications, business customer support, Business Services Resource management and delivery protocol development.Manages and develops HR software and applications implementation processes; manages, monitors, and improves enterprise resource planning (ERP) and IT processes related to prioritization, resource management, and quality assurance protocols.Acts as a liaison between central IT and HR functions, providing process, delivery, and functional HR expertise to deliver operational initiatives that drive business performance. title: Senior Analyst Compensation
job_description: Job DescriptionStaples is business to business. You’re what binds us together.Our Human Resources team has one goal: create solutions and services that foster an inclusive and innovative culture. We act as strategic partners to deliver innovative learning and development opportunities, comprehensive compensation and benefit solutions, recruiting tools and more to attract new talent and excite existing talent. We’re a compassionate, hardworking and dedicated team that knows our work makes an impact on our company every day.What You’ll Be DoingCollaborate in the design, implementation, and ongoing management of compensation structures and policies to ensure they meet organizational objectives and adhere to legal requirements.Assist in the administration of compensation programs, ensuring they are carried out effectively and aligned with organizational goals.Serve as the primary point of contact for compensation-related matters within designated functional areas, providing expertise in job evaluations, salary recommendations, and issue resolution.Offer backup support for compensation tasks across the organization, ensuring continuity and consistency in compensation practices.Conduct comprehensive analyses of external market competitiveness and internal equity to identify trends and disparities.Draw actionable insights from data analyses, making recommendations to adjust compensation policies as needed to maintain market competitiveness and internal fairness.Lead the preparation and participation in salary and compensation surveys for both salaried and hourly positions, ensuring the organization's compensation data is accurately represented in the market.Compile and analyze survey data to assess the organization's position relative to the market and identify areas for adjustment.Engage in key compensation projects, including annual merit review cycles, market pricing reviews, and strategic planning initiatives, contributing analytical support and insights.Generate regular and ad hoc reports to monitor the effectiveness and competitiveness of compensation programs, identifying trends and areas for improvement.Analyze patterns in compensation-related inquiries and issues, recommending process improvements to enhance program effectiveness and reduce future occurrences.Act as a liaison between the organization and external survey vendors, ensuring accurate and timely data submission and participation in relevant compensation surveys.What You Bring To The TableStrong analytical and problem-solving skills.Attention to detail and accuracy.Ability to handle sensitive information with discretion and integrity.Proactive and self-motivated with the ability to work independently.Strong organizational and time management skills, with the ability to prioritize tasks and manage multiple projects simultaneously.Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment, contributing positively to team operations and working relationships.Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, with a strong emphasis on Excel skills, including the ability to perform functions such as VLOOKUP, pivot tables, and basic data analysis.Effective verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey complex information in a clear and concise manner.What’s Needed- Basic Qualifications1+ years of related experience in compensation analysis or a similar role within human resources.What’s Needed- Preferred QualificationsBachelor's degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Finance, or a related field.Advanced proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including macros, complex formulas, and data modeling. Familiarity with HR Information Systems (HRIS), particularly Oracle HCM or similar platforms, is a plusPrevious internship or project experience involving quantitative analysis, statistical methods, or compensation studies is highly desirable.Progress towards or completion of relevant professional certifications, such as Certified Compensation Professional (CCP) or SHRM Certified Professional (SHRM-CP), is advantageous.Basic understanding of compensation fundamentals, such as job evaluation techniques, market pricing, and pay structure design, gained through coursework, internships, or work experience.Demonstrated ability to apply critical thinking and analytical skills to solve problems and make data-driven decisions.Experience conducting research, benchmarking studies, and industry analysis related to compensation trends and best practices.We OfferInclusive culture with associate-led Business Resource GroupsFlexible PTO (22 days) and Holiday ScheduleOnline and Retail Discounts, Company Match 401(k), Physical and Mental Health Wellness programs, and more!#stapleshiringcorporate

title: Senior Building Performance Analyst
job_description: Buro Happold is looking for a senior building performance consultant to join our expanding team. You will be part of an integrated Sustainability and Analytics Team, working closely with our MEP engineers and designers. We work across scales including high performance buildings, campus, and cities. Our current portfolio includes high-aspirational projects featuring net-zero energy and carbon projects, Living Building Challenge certified projects, and LEED Platinum certified projects. Key Objectives:As a senior building performance consultant, you will work across a range of projects, working as an integrated part of multiple project teams. You will work under the guidance of project leaders to meet the analytical needs of the project (loads models, early-stage optioneering models, LEED energy model, high-performance analysis, and renewable energy studies) and will be mentored by associates of our energy modeling team. As part of this role, you will perform Job Leader responsibilities which include ensuring technical quality, timely delivery, financial performance and client satisfaction in all matters relating to project analytics. Required Skills:Experience with energy modeling inputs, including model geometry creation and HVAC system modeling.Strong proficiency with IES Virtual Environment and/or EnergyPlus/OpenStudioExperience with ASHRAE 90.1 compliance energy modeling and ASHRAE 209Experience with Title 24 code requirements and EnergyPro/CBECC-Com compliance modelingExperience in visual scripting interfaces such as Grasshopper and Dynamo, and environmental Rhino plugins such as Honeybee, Ladybug, etc.Experience in the analysis of passive design strategies to inform early phase decisionsExperience in quantifying and graphically reporting of energy conservation measuresExperience in the analysis of renewable energy technologies such as geothermal and photovoltaicsStrong communication and organization skillsAbility to understand client goals and communicate analysis results with architectsAbility to operate independently, organize resources, and delivery to timelinesExperience of modeling commonly designed mechanical systemsExperience in presenting analytical information in a clear and concise mannerExperience with project management including successfully managing the technical quality of deliverables, schedule, internal coordination, and financial performance associated with project analytics scope Desirable Skills:Knowledge of energy audits and energy benchmarking of buildingsExperience with sustainability rating systems used in the industryCompletion of LEED energy model submittalsAn ability to apply analytical skills across a range of scale (Buildings, Campus, Cities)An ability to use a variety of tools beyond common software to analyze complex problemsKnowledge of daylight modeling or CFD analysisGenuine inner drive to automate workflows and developed energy modelling tools Qualifications:Minimum 5-8 years of experience in a professional, fast-paced environment within the AEC IndustryBA or BS degree required, architectural or engineering degree preferredExcellent verbal and written communication skillsExcellent problem-solving, research and analytical skillsCreative thinking, high attention to detail and appreciation of good designBEMP, PE, LEED AP preferred What we offer:Salary range of $85,000 to $105,000. This will be determined based on factors such as geographic location, skills, education, and/or experienceGenerous benefits packageAnnual discretionary bonusGenerous PTO (4-5 weeks depending on position) in addition to 10 paid holidays401k with company matchStudent Loan Repayment AssistanceHybrid working & summer hoursReimbursement for certain professional licenses and associated renewals and exam feesGlobal network of expertsLearning and development opportunitiesBe a part of our Young Employees Forum and our Diversity and Inclusion Forum
Industries: Design Services, Architecture and Planning, and Accessible Architecture and Design

title: Market Analyst Lead
job_description: At BBH we value diverse backgrounds, so if your experience looks a little different from what we've outlined and you think you can bring value to the role, we will still welcome your application!What You Can Expect At BBHIf you join BBH you will find a collaborative environment that enables you to step outside your role to add value wherever you can. You will have direct access to clients, information and experts across all business areas around the world. BBH will provide you with opportunities to grow your expertise, take on new challenges, and reinvent yourself—without leaving the firm. We encourage a culture of inclusion that values each employee’s unique perspective. We provide a high-quality benefits program emphasizing good health, financial security, and peace of mind. Ultimately we want you to have rewarding work with the flexibility to enjoy personal and family experiences at every career stage. Our BBH Cares program offers volunteer opportunities to give back to your community and help transform the lives of others.Brown Brothers Harriman is currently looking for a Market Analyst Lead to help drive revenue growth for our Infomediary® Data Solutions (IDS) business. IDS offers a suite of solutions for BBH clients in the data and digital space leveraging our Infomediary platform, which brings together our data management technology and managed services to help clients take full command of their data. Infomediary Data Solutions makes data useable for businesses by designing, building, and maintaining custom master data domains that drive the processes and systems that run our client’s operating models. The Market Analyst Lead will oversee the Markets Analytics team, who act as our centralized hub of market data and analytics around our product and industry. The manager will be responsible for defining and driving the business analysis, market research, and product development within the team supporting all IDS products.In this role, the Market Analyst Lead will lead the Market Analytics function, helping to define the strategy and driving all execution in partnership with the other pillars in the product organization. They will lead with a market-centric focus, owning the gathering and publishing of competitive intelligence/market research around the Data Product landscape. The Market Analytics team is responsible for gathering and documenting intelligence critical to shape our business and product roadmaps and maintains a strong awareness and documentation on market trends and emerging technologies. They will manage a team of Market Analysts, proving direction and oversight. The Market Analyst Lead will partner with the Product Management and Client Solutions teams to ensure the appropriate decisions are made related to technology development, partnerships and collaborations with external service providers, and client product requests. The Market Analyst Lead will have experience leading a function and managing people while requiring a deep understanding of the financial services industry and a deep knowledge of industry trends to help influence our product roadmaps.Overall Responsibilities & Areas Of FocusLeadership & Talent DevelopmentFocus on the growth and talent development of the Market Analysts to meet the evolving needs of the IDS model and strategic objectives by identifying required capabilities, development platforms and training needs. Lead efforts to clearly identify development and career paths within the Market Analytics organization.Promote development through mentoring, coaching, and establishing annual goal setting and professional development targets.Role model inclusive behaviors that demonstrate commitment to a workplace that values diversity of thought, background, and perspectiveBusiness AnalysisConduct business analysis for a variety of client projects and initiatives, focusing on understanding client product needs, analyzing challenges, exploring available technology, and creating innovative solutions using our tools and technologies to address the challenges.Apply industry knowledge and standards to BBH’s products and client workflows to ensure the most efficient and effective client solutions.Identify gaps in current products or processes and prepare recommendations for improvements. Lead ‘Voice of Client’ initiatives, by gathering and understanding client and prospect feedback, preferences and needs, to incorporate into business strategies and decisions that influence our product roadmap.Lead product Analysis initiatives for the Product Management and Client Solutions teamsMarket ResearchLeverage a strong understanding of industry standard messaging and communication protocols which are highly leveraged as part of the IDS BBH business.Research, analyze, and summarize information about critical market and regulatory changes in the Financial Service industry that could impact the IDS product roadmap and product suite.Use knowledge of industry trends to build and drive critical functionality into our applications.Gather and document intelligence on market trends critical to shape our business and product roadmaps (competitors, market peers, regulatory, massage standards, etc.)Own the creation of a library of well documented market information available to the IDS community to support product design.Strong awareness and documentation on market trends and emerging tech (i.e Cloud, streaming)Product DevelopmentConduct and coordinate business analysis efforts for projects and initiatives. Determine how changing business needs will affect the system, product, process, and solution. Describe the business need and potential solutions in terms that both business and technical teams can understand. Occasionally manage projects and/or workstreams and apply project management processes to administer, organize, monitor, and control program/project activities.QualificationsSuccessfully managed and led a team.Strong understanding and experience in the Financial Services Data Product landscape.Required proficiency in SQL and data management and reporting tools.Global regulatory experience required (T+1, reg reporting, TSRs)Demonstrated ability to work in a team-oriented environment.Excellent written communication skills.Ability to communicate effectively with clarity and strong influencing skills.Strong organizational skills and ability to multi-taskBachelor's degree preferred with 7+ years’ experience directly related to financial services business or technology expertise.We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, age, genetic information, creed, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other protected status under federal, state or local law.
Industries: Banking, Financial Services, and Investment Management

title: Financial Model Validation Analyst III
job_description: Company DescriptionWe help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable.Job DescriptionAs a Model Validation / Quality Assurance Analyst, you will partner with a group of software developers and product owners who implement probabilistic algorithms for modeling insurance application from catastrophic events, while consulting with them to identify areas for validation, with an emphasis on developing creative approaches to expand test coverage.ResponsibilitiesYou will ensure that products meet exacting requirements for accuracy and explicit and/or implicit validation of scientific/ financial algorithmsYou will, under minimal supervision, perform statistical and mathematical insurance analytics to validate model outputs; you will use a variety of technical tools and programing languages for data processing, summarizing, visualizing in order to verify actuarial and industry business logicYou will author and present technical documents of analytical work in Python’s Jupyter Notebook or in R Markdown, detailing your validation workYou will participate in cross-functional Agile Scrum teams while delivering concurrent day-to-day tasks and use automated testing practices throughout the software development life cycle.Successful candidates will use their strong quantitative data analytics mindset to deliver strategic projects using robust methodologies and proactively work to identify solutions to complex issues.Position requires a deep commitment to quality assurance that leverages the best practices already in place and help to enhance them.QualificationsCandidates must have an undergraduate/graduate degree in STEM-related areas (data science, engineering, science, mathematics, finance, economics) as well as a graduate degree and 2 years of relevant work experienceExperience with designing and /or validating numerical probabilistic models in engineering, science, catastrophe modeling, finance, actuarial science, etc.Should have proven experience in analytical programming, fluency in languages like Python or R, DB experience such as SQL, and knowledge of libraries like Pandas, Tidyverse, Data frames.Candidates should have an inquisitive sense of curiosity as well as excellent attention to detail and experience with deriving actionable insights from data.Candidate must have excellent communication skills to interface with cross-functional teams.Prior experience with the AWS ecosystem and technology stack is preferable.Additional InformationFor over 50 years, Verisk has been the leading data analytics and technology partner to the global insurance industry by delivering value to our clients through expertise and scale. We empower communities and businesses to make better decisions on risk, faster.At Verisk, you'll have the chance to use your voice and build a rewarding career that's as unique as you are, with work flexibility and the support, coaching, and training you need to succeed.For the eighth consecutive year, Verisk is proudly recognized as a Great Place to Work® for outstanding workplace culture in the US, fourth consecutive year in the UK, Spain, and India, and second consecutive year in Poland. We value learning, caring and results and make inclusivity and diversity a top priority. In addition to our Great Place to Work® Certification, we’ve been recognized by The Wall Street Journal as one of the Best-Managed Companies and by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and Best Employer for Women, testaments to the value we place on workplace culture.We’re 7,000 people strong. We relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation. And we are looking for people like you to help us translate big data into big ideas. Join us and create an exceptional experience for yourself and a better tomorrow for future generations.Verisk BusinessesUnderwriting Solutions — provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precisionClaims Solutions — supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiencesProperty Estimating Solutions — offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficientExtreme Event Solutions — provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events.Specialty Business Solutions — provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governanceMarketing Solutions — delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagementLife Insurance Solutions – offers end-to-end, data insight-driven core capabilities for carriers, distribution, and direct customers across the entire policy lifecycle of life and annuities for both individual and group.Verisk Maplecroft — provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become strongerVerisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.http://www.verisk.com/careers.htmlUnsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.HR CCPA Privacy Notice.pdf

title: Product Performance & Analytics Manager
job_description: About LightForce OrthodonticsLightForce Orthodontics is a 3D printing technology company focused on the orthodontic space. Our digital platform empowers orthodontists with 3D-printed tooth-moving tools. In 2019, we launched our first product - the world’s only, fully customized 3D printed bracket system and digital treatment software. We are proud to be one of the fastest growing companies in the industry. Learn more at www.lightforceortho.comDescriptionLightForce’s product management team is looking for a highly skilled and detail-oriented business analyst to join our team as a Product Performance Analytics Manager. As a key individual contributor, you will be responsible for enabling us to make better, faster decisions regarding product development and investment priorities. You will collaborate on a wide array of product and business problems with a diverse set of cross-functional partners across Product Management, Software and Hardware Engineering, Product Marketing, Service, Customer Success, Sales, and Operations.Your unique analytical and communication skills will be essential to the delivery of key insights into the clinical and operational performance of LightForce’s products. Your work will shape product development, quantify new opportunities, identify upcoming challenges, and ensure our products deliver optimal value to the business through their impact on practices and their patients.Essential Duties and Responsibilities:Apply technical expertise with quantitative analysis, experimentation, data mining, and the effective presentation of data to inform strategies for decision-makingActively participate in product planning activities, offering data-driven recommendations for product improvements and innovationsProvide support to customers and internal Customer & analyticsEducation and ExperienceBachelor’s or master’s degree in a relevant technical or quantitative field or equivalent practical experienceMinimum 5 years of experience in data analysis, business analytics or a related fieldDemonstrated ability to analyze complex data, identify trends and provide insights that have made a measurable impactRequired Qualifications:Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Domo, Power BI, etc.Experience with SQL, Excel/Google Sheets as well as statistical languages such as R, PythonExcellent communication skills and ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholdersStrong organizational, collaboration, and problem-solving skillsExperience with industry standard analytics tools like Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, etc., is plus.Preferred Qualifications: Healthcare industry experiencePhysical DemandsRequires the ability to use hands, and reach with hands and armsRequires the ability to see, listen, and speakWork EnvironmentWork is generally performed in an open office, sedentary position.Perks and Benefits (US Employees Only)Unlimited PTO for exempt employees9 paid holidays per title: Senior Analyst-Program & Project Management
job_description: When you join VerizonVerizon is one of the world's leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect around the world. We're a human network that reaches across the globe and works behind the scenes. We anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins. In crisis and in celebration, we come together-lifting up our communities and striving to make an impact to move the world forward. If you're fueled by purpose, and powered by persistence, explore a career with us. Here, you'll discover the rigor it takes to make a difference and the fulfillment that comes with living the #NetworkLife.What you'll be doing...At Verizon, we don't wait for the future, we build it! Join the industry leader in Network and Telecommunications Services as we embark on transforming our nation's critical communications infrastructure and the FAA's National Airspace System (NAS) network.As a Transition Site Readiness Project Manager, you are responsible to manage and track the interdependent deliverables from the initial site assessment through site acceptance. The lifecycle of the implementation of the site transition begins approximately 15-12 months prior to the site migration to the Verizon managed services. You have an integrated team of network engineers, infrastructure and regional project managers and order management support with Transition and Service Area Project management oversight. You will work with FAA, Network Engineering and our business partners to manage the site-specific verification of the physical and logical requirements for the Verizon's FENS managed network solution.Once you have confirmed circuit(s) installation and acceptance, site prep completion, site configuration build, and CPE readiness, you conduct "Go/No Go" with FAA site contacts and partners. Upon confirmation of readiness, CPE staging initiates. You proceed with scheduling resources, change windows, MOP updates and Provisioning activation. With assistance from Service Area Project Manager, communications and change management are submitted and dates/times approved. CPE is secured and shipped to FAA location to meet the coordinated 'time/date' for our field technician(s) partner at the site. You will work with the Service Area Transition Project Manager, Service Readiness Project Manager and the Transition and Implementation Project team for assistance in reporting, schedule, milestones, creation of jeopardy, tracking and status reports. You will have access to customized tools and the ability to work with others to potentially customize reports, analyze performance and continue to seek ways to improve service delivery for the Transition project. The Site Readiness Project Manager has the following key responsibilities:Execute and maintain project management processes in the areas of project schedule, quality management, communications management, risk/issue management, and change management.Coordinate and maintain project schedules and calendars with the input and assistance of service area project manager and transition leadsFacilitate site readiness meetings, providing meeting minutes and action items where neededBuild strong communication channels with site, district stakeholders, our field services partners, engineering, provisioning, project engineering and managed network operations.Track tasks, durations, and deliverables to ensure on time delivery. Where necessary, escalate for improvements and explore alternative solutions to meet due dates expeditiously. Responsible for tracking project changes and producing updated schedulesInfluence continuous improvement of project management methodologies including: assessment of project delivery capabilities, gathering and reporting performance metrics, establishing corresponding targets, and measurement of on-going progress.Ensure smooth communication within the project team and other cross-functional teamsInterface with internal/external stakeholders on a regular basisPrepare and document Day 1/Day 2 support documentation and acceptance criteria What we are looking for...You'll need to have:Bachelor's Degree or four or more years of experienceSupplier ManagementEnterprise Client ExperienceFinancial Business acumenFour or more years of Project Management experience with proven track record and experience with deploying and delivering complex solutionsBroad Verizon product experienceEven better if you have:Excellent organizational skillsAbility to write documentation and communicate effectively with team-membersSkills in Microsoft Office product suite, including PowerPoint, Excel & Word; Microsoft Project.Ability to work in a structured manner and according to processes and procedureProven leadership skills & capabilitiesAbility to manage and negotiate with required internal and external organizationsITIL V3 Certification Project Management Professional (PMP) Certification Proficiency in customer enablement toolsIf Verizon and this role sound like a fit for you, we encourage you to apply even if you don't meet every "even better" qualification listed above. Where you'll be workingIn this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager.Scheduled Weekly Hours40Equal Employment OpportunityWe're proud to be an equal opportunity employer - and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging. We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.Our benefits are designed to help you move forward in your career, and in areas of your life outside of Verizon. From health and wellness benefits, short term incentives, 401(k) Savings Plan, stock incentive programs, paid time off, parental leave, adoption assistance and tuition assistance, plus other incentives, we've got you covered with our award-winning total rewards package. For part-timers, your coverage will vary as you may be eligible for some of these benefits depending on your individual circumstances.If you are hired into a California, Colorado, Connecticut, Hawaii, Nevada, New York, Rhode Island or Washington work location, the compensation range for this position is between $76,000.00 and $142,000.00 annually based on a full-time schedule. The salary will vary depending on your location and confirmed job-related skills and experience. This is an incentive based position with the potential to earn more. For part time roles, your compensation will be adjusted to reflect your hours.

title: Finance Analyst Air Traffic Control Program (Hybrid)
job_description: Date Posted:2024-04-15Country:United States of AmericaLocation:MA801: Marlborough, MA 1001 Boston Post Road Building 2, Marlborough, MA, 01752 USAPosition Role Type:HybridLooking for the right runway for your career to take flight? Consider joining us here at Collins Aerospace, where we’re working side-by-side with customers on exciting industry possibilities. With a comprehensive portfolio, extensive capabilities and broad expertise, we’re crafting intelligent solutions to meet the demands of a rapidly evolving global market – all representing the best in innovation and technology for the industries we serve across commercial, business, space, and military and defense aviation.With 68,000 employees across 46 countries around the world, we offer an extensive flight list of opportunities to explore the depth of our organization. We offer flexible work options to meet your needs by offering on-site, hybrid and remote roles. Join us and help build a more advanced, more autonomous, more connected, more electric and more sustainable future!The Communications & Air Space Management (CAMS) business area is looking for an enthusiastic new college hire to be a finance professional to support the STARS (Standard Terminal Automation Replacement System) Finance team as a cost, schedule and control analyst. STARS is the Air Traffic System that is used by all US airports to control air traffic in the terminal area. It is also used by all DoD airfields across the globe. This position requires a dedicated individual who can be successful in a fast paced and demanding environment. The selected individual will be a part of the Business Management Finance team in supporting the overall finance requirements of the STARS program. In this position, you will become proficient in the financial systems, processes and procedures for the STARS program. The assignment will include, working in the EVMS tools, aiding with EACs, financial analysis, variance analysis, customer support and Program Surveillance support of the STARS program. This position requires a dedicated individual who is willing to become involved in and learn all financial aspects of STARS. Follow established standards regarding Raytheon financial policies and compliance with Sarbanes Oxley requirements. May support proposal generation and work to fulfill goals as a team player. This individual needs to be a self -starter who can work with little supervision and the ability to find solutions to complicated financial problems.May be eligible for relocationPrimary ResponsibilitiesProgram cost and schedule financial analysis, budgeting and estimatingAssist with weekly/monthly financial Earned Value reporting requirementsPerform Ad-hoc financial and variance analysis upon requestBe an active member of Finance team; seek ways to optimize/share best practices across the program. title: State Street Global Advisors - ESG Analyst, Assistant Vice President
job_description: This inclusive employer is a member of myGwork – the largest global platform for the LGBTQ+ business community.  Who we are looking forAs an ESG Analyst at State Street Global Advisors ("SSGA"), you will play a key role in fulfilling ESG-related reporting and disclosure requirements, including supporting work related to regulatory expectations and external commitments to frameworks such as the Principles for Responsible Investment. Through this work, you will support the firm's goals of maximizing our positioning in the market and providing excellent service to our clients.Select if HYBRID: This role can be performed in a hybrid model, where you can balance work from home and office to match your needs and role requirements.Why this role is important to usThe team you will be joining is a part of State Street Global Advisors, one of the largest asset managers in the world. We partner with many of the world's largest, most sophisticated investors and financial intermediaries to help them reach their goals through a rigorous, research-driven investment process. With over four decades of experience and trillions of dollars in assets under management, we offer one of the broadest selections of services across asset classes, risk profiles, regions and styles. As pioneers in index, ETF, and ESG investing, we are always inventing new ways to invest.Join us if making your mark in the asset management industry from day one is a challenge you are up for.What you will be responsible forResponsibilitiesAs an ESG Analyst (AVP), you will report into to the Global Head of ESG Operations and Administration and will be responsible for the following:Play a leading role in the firm's reporting to satisfy sustainability-related disclosure frameworks and external commitments, including but not limited to: serving as a subject matter expert about disclosure standards; understanding the firm's capabilities and practices; performing gap analyses; recommending approaches to disclosure; interacting with key stakeholders from the Investment, Risk, Compliance, Legal, and Regulatory teams; developing project plans; and monitoring deliverables and deadlinesSupport initiatives to meet ESG-related regulatory obligations in various jurisdictions, including but not limited to reporting and disclosure obligationsCollaborate with cross-functional teams and engage key stakeholders across the firm to help drive ESG prioritiesServe as a centralized ESG resource for colleagues across the Investments teamHelp develop and implement ESG policies, procedures, business controls/ process documentation and oversightMonitor and summarize ESG market, regulatory, and industry developmentsContribute to a variety of ongoing tasks and special projects related to the firm's obligations and/or commitments as needs evolveWhat we valueThese Skills Will Help You Succeed In This RoleRobust time management skills with the ability to coordinate multiple deliverables at one time, including assigning tasks, following up on their completion, keeping senior leaders informed of progress, and escalating potential obstaclesStrong organizational skills with exceptional attention to detailsAbility to work independently and execute tasks, as well as to collaborate with teammates and build relationships across levels and functional groups to advance significant projects and initiativesStrong written communication and verbal presentation skills to clearly convey requests and requirementsDemonstration of resilience in a fast-paced environment and in the face of uncertain or evolving standards and requirementsNatural curiosity and desire to learn ESG concepts in a rapidly developing marketplaceExperience implementing policies, procedures, and business controlsEducation & Preferred QualificationsBachelor's degree required5-7 years of experience in financial servicesProficiency in Microsoft PowerPoint and ExcelExperience working for an asset manager and/or ESG-related organizationAcademic or work experience in ESG-related topics such as climate change and environment preferredKnowledge of ESG reporting frameworks such as Principles for Responsible Investment preferredAdditional RequirementsAre you the right candidate? Yes!We truly believe in the power that comes from the diverse backgrounds and experiences our employees bring with them. Although each vacancy details what we are looking for, we don't necessarily need you to fulfil all of them when applying. If you like change and innovation, seek to see the bigger picture, make data driven decisions and are a good team player, you could be a great fit.About State Street Global AdvisorsWhat We Do. As the asset management arm of State Street Corporation, State Street Global Advisors has served the world's governments, institutions and financial advisors for over four decades. With a rigorous, risk-aware approach built on research, analysis and market-tested experience, we build from a breadth of active and index strategies to create cost-effective solutions. As stewards, we help portfolio companies see that what is fair for people and sustainable for the planet can deliver long-term performance. And, as pioneers in index, ETF, and ESG investing, we are always inventing new ways to invest. As a result, we have become one of the world's largest asset managers with trillions of dollars under our care.Our Mission. At State Street Global Advisors our mission is to invest responsibly to enable economic prosperity and social progress. We are driven by a desire to help our clients, and those who rely on them, achieve a better future. We have a long history of developing innovative investment strategies to provide our clients with reliable and transparent returns, cost-effectively, and without excessive risk.Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary by location, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans, among other perks. You'll have access to Flexible Work Programs to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees' diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift programs and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.Company: State Street Global AdvisorsSalary Range$90,000 - $142,500 AnnualThe range quoted above applies to the role in the primary location specified. If the candidate would ultimately work outside of the primary location above, the applicable range could differ.

title: Senior Inventory Analyst
job_description: ResponsibilitiesInventory Modeling & Forecasting- Based on current business conditions and product life cycle what inventory and liabilities should TER have. Identifying and reconciling gaps from the inventory model to actual inventory levels. Report to management findings as well as identifying areas of opportunity. Drive inventory reduction initiatives across functional groups to capitalize on opportunities identified in analytical work.Manage the Excess & Obsolete quarterly process - Review up to $800M in gross inventory. You will work closely with our main subcontract manufacturer in understanding inventories through the complete supply chain. Understand inventory changes quarter over quarter. Integrate with marketing and demand management on finding customer forecasts. Present to finance your findings and recommend appropriate inventory provisions.Product allocations- Updating and maintaining all products component allocations for new parts and existing parts to find which platform they are used on.Inventory Scrap analysis - Perform statistical analysis on inventory forecast and historical shipments. Communicate with Demand Management, Finance, New Products, and Global service groups to find appropriate inventory scrap.Customer Material returns - Key operations person to review and manage customer returns to ensure formal disposition plan is place and executed.Consignment and Aging Material- Review subcontractors excess and obsolete inventory. Validate and approve claims.Participate in processes and application continual improvement projects.Potential travel to perform audits in factories and warehouses across the world including Malaysia, Philippines, Costa Rica, Japan, etc..QualificationsBA/BS degreeMBA would be a plus10-15 years of industry experience focusing on supply chain, inventory/business analyst, MRP or planningStrong statistical analysis and problem-solving skills.Excellent communication skills both written and verbal.Strong presentation skills.Thorough knowledge of the concepts of MRP and Planning.Proficient Excel and PowerPoint.Some knowledge of Oracle and Kinaxis Rapid Response would be a plus.Must be able to juggle many different activities and prioritize accordingly.

title: Sr Analyst, Procurement Risk Management
job_description: Description:Abiomed is currently recruiting for a Sr Analyst, Risk Management to be based in Danvers, MA or Aachen, Germany.Abiomed, part of Johnson & Johnson MedTech, is a leading provider of medical devices that provide circulatory and respiratory support, with a mission of recovering hearts & saving lives. Abiomed's "Patients First!" culture drives our skilled workforce and strong relationships with clinicians. Our innovative product portfolio and robust pipeline provide us the incredible opportunity to bring lifesaving technology to more patients around the world than ever before. Founded in 1981, Abiomed has a proven track record for growth, integrity and innovation.I Am Abiomed | I Am Heart Recovery | Patients First!Risk management is a key functional capability to build resilient supply base and support projected business growth. We are recruiting a senior analyst to strengthen our risk management group, under procurement. The Risk Management team in procurement will be responsible to manage, mitigate and avoid risks in material and services categories, which includes direct material categories, external manufacturing, and indirect categories. This role will report to the senior manager and support operational activities in supplier risk management scope. This person will also support developing risk mitigation strategies and execute those working closely with procurement categories, and internal cross functions.Primary responsibilities of this role are:Own and Manage supplier risk databases and develop insights for procurement and supply chain teams.Conduct supply risk assessments for suppliers across holistic risk indicators including strategic, financial, geopolitical, capacity, supply and logistics, cybersecurity, and compliance etc.Support developing and executing risk mitigation plans for short term, annual and long-term growth projections in collaboration with category managers.Conduct source risk assessment and mitigation plan at product level including new products in development.Develop risk alerts based on severity of risks and act with sense of urgency to mitigate risks.Support risk management lead and category managers to develop Business continuity plans for high-risk suppliers.Support in development of overall risk management strategy for procurement and embed those into base business practices.Develop visibility of risks to tier 2/3 for key material categories and incorporate findings in sourcing strategies.Work collaboratively to develop predictive risk management practices and deploy for procurement scope.Collaborate with category managers to embed risk management solutions into sourcing strategies, supplier relationship management and contracting activities.Support business planning process to incorporate risk management projects and required resourcing. Track and Share supply risk monitoring database with defined period.Collaborate with other risk management teams in enterprise procurement, supply chain to bring best practices and solutions to Abiomed.Support Risk management team lead to evaluate and drive adoption of digital tools to make sustained risk sensing approach.Qualifications:Bachelors in engineering, Operations/Supply chain management or related field, MBA/MS preferred.A minimum of 4 years of strong experience in procurement and/ or related supply chains required, with exposure to risk management scope.Experience in multiple disciplines of Supply Chain, including External Operations, Manufacturing, Procurement, Distribution and / or Quality related field is advantageous.Familiarity with material categories, including electronics, machining (metal, plastics, ceramics), molding, assembling, Tooling and manufacturing processes, is advantageous.Strong analytical mindset and ability to work with complex data / information set is required.Strong verbal and written communication skill with ability to confidently present complex informationExperience to work across regions and understand markets.Strong Business Acumen with Medical Devices (specifically Abiomed relevant industry) experience preferred.Continuous improvement/lean/six sigma experience, black belt preferred.Experience with SAP preferred, or another ERP, device management and digital procurement systems.Johnson & Johnson is an Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, national origin, or protected veteran status and will not be discriminated against on the basis of disability.

title: Manager - Forensic Accounting, Compliance
job_description: If you seek a fast-paced, people-first firm with a collaborative culture, StoneTurn may be the right place for you. StoneTurn, a global professional services firm, works with law firms, corporations, and government agencies in solving the most complex and consequential business issues. StoneTurn has earned the trust of clients and regulators worldwide by deploying multidisciplinary teams of industry leaders to provide unique expertise with forensics and investigations, risk and compliance, data and technology, economic and dispute advisory, and strategic business consulting. Founded in 2004, StoneTurn operates from offices across five continents and is widely lauded for its commitment to collaboration, integrity, and independence. StoneTurn is seeking a qualified Manager to join our Forensic Accounting and Compliance & Monitoring practice. This will be based in Boston, Chicago, or Washington DC. Job SummaryIn this position you will be responsible for managing client engagements and contributing to the marketing efforts for the Forensic Accounting and Compliance & Monitoring practice. You will add value to our team by having previous experience in the service line and some experience in business development within the marketplace. This position requires you to be a person with strong interpersonal, communication and technical skills.  ResponsibilitiesDemonstrate a strong understanding of planning and management of engagements for a variety of forensic and compliance matters possessing the ability to direct and assist in the performance of financial analyses, forensic investigations, controls and compliance remediation, fraud, waste & abuse and other engagement needsReview and summarize client documents, analyst reports, and third party financial and industry dataCreate and develop client deliverables including, but not limited to, research summaries, expert reports, and the presentation of findingsIntegrate with all other StoneTurn practice areas to deliver coordinated services on investigations and compliance mattersLead and participate in marketing and networking initiativesDevelop and maintain client relationshipsBuild client base internal (cross-functional) and external relationshipsAccountable for multiple priorities/projects, timely preparation and quality control of client deliverables while managing the expectations of clients to help ensure satisfactionEffectively manage risks associated with engagementsDemonstrate professionalism and foster a team-oriented environment through maintaining the confidential and proprietary nature of client relationships and related work product and by maintaining a positive and cooperative attitude Facilitate client and internal team meetings to document client objectives and requirements, while making recommendations and determining the best solutionsMentor and develop Senior Consultants and Consultants by providing timely performance feedback/training and conducting performance reviewsFoster a positive, efficient and team-oriented environmentEnsure consistent high-quality work productResearch emerging issues and identify market facing opportunitiesAssist with engagement management administration, including billing and conflict checksRequired qualificationsB.A. in Accounting or related field; CPA is strongly recommended5+ years of strong experience in accounting, auditing or compliance.Flexibility with the potential travel requirements of client engagementsExcellent managerial, leadership, organizational, and verbal/written communication skillsDemonstrated ability to structure and perform technical projects, manage client expectations and relationshipsExcellent prioritization skillsCommitment to exemplary client service deliveryDesirable qualificationsExperience in a professional services firm Network of relationships within law firms and corporate legal departmentsOther professional designation(s) (CAMS, CFE, CFF) We offer competitive compensation and benefit packages. Applicants for employment in US must have work authorization that does not now or in the future require sponsorship by StoneTurn.StoneTurn provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, veteran status or genetics.  For additional information, go to www.stoneturn.com.

title: Senior Model Validation Analyst II
job_description: Company DescriptionWe help the world see new possibilities and inspire change for better tomorrows. Our analytic solutions bridge content, data, and analytics to help business, people, and society become stronger, more resilient, and sustainable.Job DescriptionOur Extreme Event Solutions team develops catastrophe models and software that help the (re)insurance industry make objective and data-driven decisions. As a thought leader in the (re)insurance industry, we strive to develop exceptional models and drive technological innovation.As a Model Validation / Quality Assurance Analyst, you will partner with a group of scientists and structural engineers who develop stochastic models and run Monte Carlo simulations for catastrophic events, while consulting with them to identify areas for model validation, with an emphasis on developing creative approaches to expand test coverage.Additionally, you will create detailed test plans and strategies to ensure the model has full QA coverage.You will ensure the products meet exacting requirements for accuracy and explicit and/or implicit validation of scientific, engineering, and financial algorithms.You will, under minimal supervision, be constantly and creatively manipulating and transforming data, performing advanced statistical and spatial analysis to validate complex model components, and summarizing findings to be presented at all levels of Verisk.You will author technical documents in Python’s Jupyter Notebook or in R Markdown detailing your validation work.You will participate in cross-functional Agile Scrum teams while delivering concurrent day-to-day tasks and use automated testing practices throughout the software development life cycle.Successful candidates will use their strong quantitative data analytics mindset to deliver strategic projects using robust methodologies and proactively work to identify solutions to complex issues.Position requires a deep commitment to quality assurance that leverages the best practices already in place and help to enhance them.QualificationsFamiliarity of advanced analytics, such as stochastic models and Monte Carlo simulations preferredCandidates must have an undergraduate degree in STEM related areas (data science, engineering, science, mathematics, finance, economics)Candidates must have minimum 4-6 years of relevant work experience or graduate degree and 2-3 years of relevant work experience.Must have proven experience in analytical programming, fluency in languages like Python or R, DB experience such as SQL, and knowledge of libraries like Pandas, Tidyverse, Data frames.Candidates will ideally have experience working with GIS tools and large data sets, performing analysis, manipulations, and data visualizations.Experience with designing and/or validating numerical probabilistic models in engineering, science, catastrophe modeling, finance, actuarial science, etc.Candidates should have an inquisitive sense of curiosity as well as excellent attention to detail and experience with deriving actionable insights from data.Candidate must have excellent communication skills to interface with cross-functional teams.Prior experience with the AWS ecosystem and technology stack is preferable.Additional InformationFor over 50 years, Verisk has been the leading data analytics and technology partner to the global insurance industry by delivering value to our clients through expertise and scale. We empower communities and businesses to make better decisions on risk, faster.At Verisk, you'll have the chance to use your voice and build a rewarding career that's as unique as you are, with work flexibility and the support, coaching, and training you need to succeed.For the eighth consecutive year, Verisk is proudly recognized as a Great Place to Work® for outstanding workplace culture in the US, fourth consecutive year in the UK, Spain, and India, and second consecutive year in Poland. We value learning, caring and results and make inclusivity and diversity a top priority. In addition to our Great Place to Work® Certification, we’ve been recognized by The Wall Street Journal as one of the Best-Managed Companies and by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and Best Employer for Women, testaments to the value we place on workplace culture.We’re 7,000 people strong. We relentlessly and ethically pursue innovation. And we are looking for people like you to help us translate big data into big ideas. Join us and create an exceptional experience for yourself and a better tomorrow for future generations.Verisk BusinessesUnderwriting Solutions — provides underwriting and rating solutions for auto and property, general liability, and excess and surplus to assess and price risk with speed and precisionClaims Solutions — supports end-to-end claims handling with analytic and automation tools that streamline workflow, improve claims management, and support better customer experiencesProperty Estimating Solutions — offers property estimation software and tools for professionals in estimating all phases of building and repair to make day-to-day workflows the most efficientExtreme Event Solutions — provides risk modeling solutions to help individuals, businesses, and society become more resilient to extreme events.Specialty Business Solutions — provides an integrated suite of software for full end-to-end management of insurance and reinsurance business, helping companies manage their businesses through efficiency, flexibility, and data governanceMarketing Solutions — delivers data and insights to improve the reach, timing, relevance, and compliance of every consumer engagementLife Insurance Solutions – offers end-to-end, data insight-driven core capabilities for carriers, distribution, and direct customers across the entire policy lifecycle of life and annuities for both individual and group.Verisk Maplecroft — provides intelligence on sustainability, resilience, and ESG, helping people, business, and societies become strongerVerisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.http://www.verisk.com/careers.htmlUnsolicited resumes sent to Verisk, including unsolicited resumes sent to a Verisk business mailing address, fax machine or email address, or directly to Verisk employees, will be considered Verisk property. Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.HR CCPA Privacy Notice.pdf

title: Client Development Manager
job_description: With the acquisition of Wilkinson Ecological Design (WED) by Ecotone in 2022, two regional leaders in the field of ecological restoration have come together under Ecotone to create a best-in-class, national firm focused solely on ecological restoration, with a focus on the implementation of high-quality restoration projects. With a highly skilled and experienced financial investor, this growth company is building a team of nationally recognized experts. The Client Development Manager (CDM) joins this phenomenal team to drive business growth in the Northeast region.Primary RoleThe CDM will drive and support the regional growth of our organization in line with our company’s purpose, values, and quality standards. As a growth company, we expect to increase revenue to $12 million in the next 2 years, while maintaining our current margin structure and high quality of work. Primary responsibilities will be working with the Client Success Manager, Regional Business Unit Leader, as well as various national thought leaders in the fields of stream, floodplain, and coastal restoration to develop sales opportunities into contracts in the Northeast region. The CDM will collaborate with WED’s Founder to advance strategic business development goals while nurturing trusted advisor relationships with clients and delivering comprehensive ecological solutions. The CDM will work with many external and internal stakeholders to envision and create opportunities for WED to accomplish its mission of restoring the integrity and biodiversity of natural systems throughout New England.Our team makes a difference in the lives of our clients, colleagues, and the environment, above all else.The position will initially focus on growth in our core Massachusetts habitat restoration, resiliency, and mitigation market segments. There will be an opportunity for the CDM to grow their career and drive growth of WED’s core services into new states across New England, while looking to diversify growth into new market segments. This position will report to the Client Success Manager.Principal Accountabilities:Plays a critical role in our growth-oriented company—helping increase our gross sales to $12M in two years.Develops and scopes new initiatives and projects, develops proposals, conducts presentations, and performs other activities related to selling and delivering WED services.Collaborates with Project Managers and Design Staff and contributes information for project estimates and proposals prepared by estimating staff. Identifies and drives growth of outbound leads with existing and potential clients through continuous interaction across our expanding environmental network.Influences and promotes the expansion or establishment of business opportunities through partnering relationships with potential clients and coordinated efforts with other WED and Ecotone service offerings. Participates in the company’s prompt response to new project leads. Attends initial meetings with potential clients to assess the needs of the client.Presents and represents WED at trade shows and technical seminars to build WED/Ecotone brand awareness and broaden the market and client base.Leverage the internal team analyst to research and vet new market opportunities and optimize sales activity within target client segments.Represents WED professionally and ethically in the marketplace.Manages strategic deployment and execution of regional business development goals and initiatives.Networks and serves as the liaison for commercial clients who retain WED as a subcontractor, as well as with other professionals to secure new project opportunities and expand our professional network of business referrals. Continually improve personal selling and business development skills, acquires industry knowledge, and broadens/applies expertise in environmental service offerings. Qualifications:Bachelor’s degree coupled with 5+ years of relevant experience. Undergraduate degree in environmental science or engineering and/or Master’s degree a plus. Demonstrated expertise in managing a sales process, developing client relationships, and documenting success using a CRM or ERP.Familiarity/experience with Massachusetts Wetlands Protection Act, regulations, and policies, as well as local wetlands protection bylaws and regulation and conservation commission project review procedures a plus.Familiarity with native plant communities, invasive plant management, ecological restoration, and bioengineering construction a plus.Microsoft Office proficiency.Ability to provide leadership and work respectfully as a team with co-workers.Strong interpersonal and relationship-building skills.Ability to effectively communicate orally and in writing.

The candidate should have excellent analytical and problem-solving skills, someone with creativity and self-motivation to deliver on mission critical projects with tight timelines and competing priorities. analysis, support modelling, data mappingEnd to end understanding of the platform, navigations, setup/configurationsUnder direct supervision, plans, organizes and controls the activities of understanding of the impact of problems across the organization and facilitates a collaborative solution What we value These skills will help you succeed in this roleExcellent business analysis and System analysisAbility to manage through complex issues and realign priorities and deliverables to ensure milestones and targets are achievedStrong interpersonal, communication, facilitation, presentation, and negotiation skillsStrong relationship management skills with demonstrated ability to work across global SSC business linesStrong prioritization management and resource management skills Education & Preferred Qualifications Bachelor's Degree required9 plus years of financial services experience6 plus years of Business Analysis experience in financial industry in the Middle office and Back-office systemsExperience working with JIRA, Clarity, Confluence, Agile frameworkStrong PC skills, including office applications and project scheduling and flowcharting softwareExpertise with project management methodology and tools and experienced with budget and cost trackingScrum Master experience is a plus About State Street  What we do.
