Must be detail oriented with strong analytical skills.Internships, co-op assignments or part time work in IT desirable.

title: Digital Intelligence Business Analyst
job_description: 2091023Job DescriptionThe RoleDo you have a passion for understanding the complexities of family relationships? Do you have a vision for how data and intelligent technologies can transform and contribute to our understanding of how people relate and engage with each other? Are you curious about the intersection of psychology, familial relationships, and engagement behavior across different generations around emotional and complex topics?The Fidelity Center for Family Engagement is scaling their relationship-based capacity to research these questions, and we are looking for an intellectually curious research and analytical-minded individual to help us grow.As a Sr. Manager, Digital Data & Intelligence Business Analyst, you will be a critical squad member responsible for working with and supporting the FCFE CPO to conduct research to inform near and next state missions and partner with our FCFE thought leadership research team on identifying/iterating data analytics and reporting needs to help the center meet our research learning and experimental deliverables. You will also write epics and user stories that translate business needs into functional requirements and validate via user testing development phases.At FCFE, we harness the collective intelligence and passion lead by our thought leaders and domain experts and have a unique, entrepreneurial start-up culture within Fidelity. It is best suited for individuals that thrive in a fast pace, continuous learning environment and can adapt quickly to change and ambiguity, while seeing the bigger vision and next state mission.The Expertise and Skills You BringBachelor’s or master’s degree, ideally in an data analytics or technical field, or equivalent experience.5 to 9 years of experience in business analysis or data/development-related roles.Experience working in financial services, financial technology, or adjacent industries. Ability to translate detailed requirements into technical requirements that ensure all parties share a common vision of the project’s scope and functionality.Experience working in startups and/or innovation labs within large companiesExperience working with data and intelligence developers to build and implement innovative products and solutions.Hands on experience with Large Language Models (LLMs), prompt engineering, chain of thought prompting a plusResearch skills to uncover and investigate unmet needs and help team craft meaningful and usable solutions.Experience in reverse engineering and understanding existing technology solutions.You have a great attitude, love being part of a creative culture and thrive on being an effective contributor. Proficient in agile practices (backlog management, story writing, story mapping, visual planning, use of personas, outcome-based planning, etc.).The Value You DeliverStrong inclination to understand FCFE, our approach and missionCollaborative approach to working in an agile framework while also understanding the center’s deliberate design processes/framework Natural curiosity for keeping a pulse on emerging financial services, financial planning tools, adjacent spaces, intelligence technology, user experiences and social trends.Keeping a pulse on emerging financial services, financial planning tools, adjacent spaces, intelligence technology, user experiences and social trends.Assessing and researching current uses of existing technologies across the enterprise AND in the marketplace to determine the potential options to consider for business decisioning. Driving and supporting key aspects of the strategy and product development life cycle including research, business requirements, and crafting and implementing end-to-end digital experiences.Delivery focused with strong dedication to quality and ability to take full ownership CertificationsCompany OverviewFidelity Investments is a privately held company with a mission to strengthen the financial well-being of our clients. We help people invest and plan for their future. We assist companies and non-profit organizations in delivering benefits to their employees. And we provide institutions and independent advisors with investment and technology solutions to help invest their own clients’ money.Join UsAt Fidelity, you’ll find endless opportunities to build a meaningful career that positively impacts peoples’ lives, including yours. You can take advantage of flexible benefits that support you through every stage of your career, empowering you to thrive at work and at home. Honored with a Glassdoor Employees’ Choice Award, we have been recognized by our employees as a top 10 Best Place to Work in 2024. And you don’t need a finance background to succeed at Fidelity—we offer a range of opportunities for learning so you can build the career you’ve always imagined.Fidelity's working model blends the best of working offsite with maximizing time together in person to meet associate and business needs. Currently, most hybrid roles require associates to work onsite all business days of one assigned week per four-week period (beginning in September 2024, the requirement will be two full assigned weeks).At Fidelity, we value honesty, integrity, and the safety of our associates and customers within a heavily regulated industry. Certain roles may require candidates to go through a preliminary credit check during the screening process. Candidates who are presented with a Fidelity offer will need to go through a background investigation, detailed in this document, and may be asked to provide additional documentation as requested. This investigation includes but is not limited to a criminal, civil litigations and regulatory review, employment, education, and credit review (role dependent). These investigations will account for 7 years or more of history, depending on the role. Where permitted by federal or state law, Fidelity will also conduct a pre-employment drug screen, which will review for the following substances: Amphetamines, THC (marijuana), cocaine, opiates, phencyclidine.We invite you to Find Your Fidelity at fidelitycareers.com.Fidelity Investments is an equal opportunity employer. We believe that the most effective way to attract, develop and retain a diverse workforce is to build an enduring culture of inclusion and belonging.Fidelity will reasonably accommodate applicants with disabilities who need adjustments to participate in the application or interview process. To initiate a request for an accommodation, contact the HR Accommodation Team by sending an email to accommodations@fmr.com, or by calling 800-835-5099, prompt 2, option 3.

title: Sr. Business Analyst - Investment Risk, AVP - State Street Global Advisors
job_description: Who We Are Looking ForWe are currently seeking a senior business analyst with data analysis experience. The role will be on the information technology team partnering with the risk analysts to continue to enhance SSGA’s Risk Technology Platform. The individual will write the detailed business and system specifications on enhancements, data loading, and data transformation; conducting data analysis of holdings, fund flow, and market data that drive the risk analytics.The successful candidate will have strong data analysis skills, can build partnerships, foster close collaboration and work hand in hand with both business and technology teams. The candidate must possess an inherent understanding of technologies, relationships between technology, data, operations, and business areas to accomplish speed to market technology solutions.What You Will Be Responsible ForAs the IT Business Analyst for Risk Technology Platform, you willPartner with multiple stakeholders to understand and document investment risk methodologies.Proficient in SQL to conduct detailed data analysis on Risk Analytics, Holdings, Fund Flows, and Market Data.Collaborate with multiple stakeholders to understand the data sources and operational processes, and data dependencies.Document and clearly communicate the business and system specifications; review with business stakeholders, and obtain approval for developments.Knowledge-share the business specifications with development team; facilitate the technical design; and create the system specifications and agile stories.Lead story grooming, provide subsequent clarifications, and approve QA test cases.Facilitate project meetings, proactively identify and remove impediments, escalate issues, and regularly report the status to the business group.Collaborate with others across the organization to work out deliverables dependencies and timelines as applicable.Maintain project artifacts, document lessons learned, and continuously refine and streamline the framework to implement technology solutions.Work with stakeholders to prioritize and track technology initiatives and corresponding regulatory reporting requirements.What We ValueThese skills will help you succeed in this roleMust be highly proficient in SQLMust have solid knowledge of mutual fund holdings, security reference data, market pricing data.Working knowledge of risk analytics is preferredWorking experience with BI tools such as Tableau is preferredExperience with multi-asset class proprietary / vended risk analytics engines (e.g. , FactSet PA, Bloomberg PORT+, BarraOne, Axioma) is preferable5+ years of past experience as a business analyst implementing technology solutions with asset management firm(s).Highly organized, and ability to work on multiple related initiativesExcellent communication skills and confidence in dealing with all levels of the organization, both internal and externalSolid presentation skillsEducation & Preferred QualificationsQualified degreeFinancial Services background, including investment or asset managementInformation technology expertiseAbout State StreetWhat we do. State Street is one of the largest custodian banks, asset managers and asset intelligence companies in the world. From technology to product innovation, we’re making our mark on the financial services industry. For more than two centuries, we’ve been helping our clients safeguard and steward the investments of millions of people. We provide investment servicing, data & analytics, investment research & trading and investment management to institutional clients.Work, Live and Grow. We make all efforts to create a great work environment. Our benefits packages are competitive and comprehensive. Details vary by location, but you may expect generous medical care, insurance and savings plans, among other perks. You’ll have access to flexible Work Programs to help you match your needs. And our wealth of development programs and educational support will help you reach your full potential.Inclusion, Diversity and Social Responsibility. We truly believe our employees’ diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives are a powerful contributor to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can thrive and reach their maximum potential while adding value to both our organization and our clients. We warmly welcome candidates of diverse origin, background, ability, age, sexual orientation, gender identity and personality. Another fundamental value at State Street is active engagement with our communities around the world, both as a partner and a leader. You will have tools to help balance your professional and personal life, paid volunteer days, matching gift programs and access to employee networks that help you stay connected to what matters to you.State Street is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.Salary Range$90,000 - $142,500 AnnualThe range quoted above applies to the role in the primary location specified. If the candidate would ultimately work outside of the primary location above, the applicable range could differ.Job ID: R-749251
Industries: Financial Services, Investment Banking, and Investment Management

title: Principal Business Systems Analyst (Oracle ERP Techno Functional)
company: Broad Institute of MIT and Harvard
job_description: General informationLocationCambridge, MARef #38743Job FamilyAdministrationDate published16-Apr-2024Time TypeFull_timeDescription & RequirementsThe Broad IT Services (BITS) group believes exceptional people produce exceptional products and services. We are committed to building the best team we can in service of the Institute's mission of "Accelerating the Understanding and Treatment of Disease." Our team of highly accomplished technical experts work with 1000’s of Broad researchers to create, scale, and run a wide range of technology solutions. We believe that a diverse and inclusive community is essential to achieving our mission. We are always looking for committed, mission-driven individuals to bring new viewpoints, experiences, and creativity to the team. We are seeking candidates who are motivated to learn new technologies and are willing to take on challenges with enthusiasm! The Enterprise Systems group within BITS is seeking qualified candidates to join our team and contribute to the operation of the Broad’s Oracle Cloud landscape. The successful candidate will be responsible for providing business system support to Oracle Cloud ERP Platform and Oracle Integration Cloud. The candidate will be responsible for driving solutions to complex business problems besides tracking issues and bringing them to closure. The resource will be also responsible for providing configuration, environment setup, and deployment support as well. This is a hybrid role and requires a minimum of 2 days per week onsite. Job Duties and Responsibilities Analyzes and evaluates business requirements by working with the finance team. Provides recommendations on the nature, scope, and complexity of solutions. Excellent written and verbal communication skills and the ability to interact professionally with a diverse group of executives, managers, and subject matter experts. Gather Business Requirements and build out development requirements/tasks Oversee the Oracle Cloud Platform and system integration projects. Perform setups and configurations in Account Receivables, General Ledger, Fixed Assets, Cash Management and PPM modules. Manage environment refreshes, deployments, and setups. Perform Oracle upgrades and patch releases to Cloud landscape Perform SSL certificate update on Oracle cloud environments Uses troubleshooting skills to identify, research and propose solutions to problems and accommodate necessary changes or corrective action, as needed. Recommends standards, procedures, and process improvements in the oracle cloud space Contribute to training initiatives and share knowledge with team members., business users and less experienced staff. Basic Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Finance, Accounting or equivalent required Good understanding of Oracle implementation methodology 7+ years of experience in Oracle ERP Environment 5+ years working directly with engineering teams with Oracle products. 3+ years’ experience in managing oracle environments, configuration, and setups. Interact with customers and provide guidance with Fixed Assets, Cash Management, AP, AR, GL, and PPM Modules. Excellent organizational, communication (written and verbal), collaborative, analytic, and interpersonal skills. Proven ability to deliver quality work in a fast-paced, customer-focused environment and experience with relational databases including SQL. Experience with writing test scripts, documenting business processes, and managing complex system configuration. Knowledge of Microsoft Office or Google docs and comfort with web-based applications. Experience with project management tools, such as JIRA or Azure DevOps Proficient with Oracle security and identity management architecture Adaptable to new technologies and/or applications Preferred Skills: Experience with configuring oracle cloud applications or others like Google, Amazon, Azure and Salesforce Experience with developing implementation and deployment plans in an oracle or other cloud environments Working knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle

title: Senior Business System Analyst
company: Global Technical Talent, an Inc. 5000 Company
job_description: Contract Duration 6 MonthsPay rate up to $63/hrJob Description:Under limited supervision, the Business Systems Analyst supports IT goals and objectives by working closely with Project Managers, IT Managers, and business stakeholders to ensure application development and implementation meets the business requirements. Senior Business System Analyst works with internal and external off-site Project Managers, Technical Designers and Developers, and other key stakeholders to identify and document requirements and use cases in a manner that is accurate and meaningful to business and IT professionals. This position also demonstrates leadership in the team environment.Job Responsibilities:Must have prior DQ Business Systems Analyst experience and a proven understanding of the use case documentation process. Work with Project Managers and other key stakeholders (IT Managers, IT Designers and Developers, and Subject Matter Experts (SMEs)) to develop and document requirements and use cases in a manner that is clear, accurate, meaningful, and understood by all. Facilitate IT and business use case walk-thru sessions. Mentor less experienced Business Systems Analysts; review use case documentation and provide constructive feedback. Senior Business System Analysts must maintain a thorough understanding of DQ's business practices and the applications/systems that support them. Work with IT and business users to evaluate options and recommend solutions in line with IT and/or business architecture. Develop reusable templates and maintain Business Systems Analyst methodology. Prepare documentation using tools such as Visio, Word, and Excel. Identify and implement process improvements.Benefits:Medical, Vision, and Dental Insurance Plans401k Retirement FundAbout the Company:Our Client is a Leading Financial Services Organization committed to helping people attain healthier lives and Lifetime Financial security. They provide a wide range of protection and wealth products and services like insurance, Advice, investments, and Asset management services in key markets around the world including Canada, the United States, the United Kingdom, Asia, and other parts of the world.They have more than 34,000 employees and 112,900 advisors worldwide. Join client organizations and help drive transformation, sustainability, and innovation for our Clients, Employees, partners, and communities.#gtthcr

title: Senior Financial Analyst - Logistics Finance
job_description: Senior Financial Analyst, Corporate Finance – Logistics *Hybrid work model, 2 days per week in office Are you looking to impact the financial and operational plans for a multibillion dollar business? Are you someone that takes the time to understand the story behind why decisions are made? If so, we are looking for someone like you! This role presents the opportunity to be a strategic partner to our global logistics and finance teams by providing the critical analyses needed to support our global supply chain’s goals and objectives! Responsibilities:Create new dashboards and analytical tools to provide insights from a highly complex supply chain network supporting over 3,500 U.S. storesIndependently analyze and report financial and operational performance against planPartner with operational and financial leaders to understand key business decisions and their impacts on the supply chain. Coordinate and execute analyses with cross-functional teams; build solutions, provide answers, and think critically about end-to-end impactsGain exposure to the company’s most pressing challenges and strategic priorities, with an opportunity to drive outcomes through strategic analysisRegular presentation across all levels of management, including Chief Logistics Officer, Divisional CFOs, and other leaders throughout the organization  Ideal Candidate:3-5+ years of professional experience, backgrounds in Finance, Consulting, start-ups, or other relevant experienceSelf-starter with strong attention to detail, proven analytical skills and quantitative abilities, and innate curiosity to learn new conceptsExperience developing complex reporting with multiple data sourcesAbility to work within tight deadlines and time manage across multiple projectsExperience with key financial concepts, including financial statements, attribution analysis, cash flow and return on investmentExcellent communication skills, both verbal and writtenStrong drive to improve and streamline processesAdvanced Excel skills; experience with databases, such as SQL and Access is a plusBachelor’s degree with majors in Finance, Economics or Logistics/Supply Chain preferred but not required We care about our culture, but we also prioritize your needs! Benefits include Associate discount; 401(k) match; medical/dental/vision; HSA; health care FSA; life insurance; short/long term disability; paid holidays/vacation/sick/bereavement/parental leave; EAP; incentive programs for management; auto/home insurance discounts; tuition reimbursement; scholarship program; adoption/surrogacy assistance; smoking cessation; childcare/cell phone discounts; pet/legal insurance; credit union; referral bonuses. All benefits are subject to applicable plan or program terms (including eligibility terms) and may change from time to time. Contact your TJX representative for more information. This position has a starting salary range of $80,500 to $102,700 per year.Actual starting pay is determined by a number of factors, including relevant skills, qualifications, and experience.This position is eligible for an annual incentive.

title: Analyst, Wealth Management
job_description: Company Overview:For nearly 30 years, Cerulli has provided global asset and wealth management firms with unmatched, actionable insights. Headquartered in Boston, Cerulli Associates is a global research and consulting firm that provides financial institutions with guidance in strategic positioning and new business development. Our analysts blend industry knowledge, original research, and data analysis to bring perspective to current market conditions and forecasts for future developments.Position Overview:This analyst position works within the Wealth Management practice and reports to a Director, Wealth Management. It is a hybrid role in the Boston office. The primary function of this role will be to lead primary research efforts into wealth management technology as it is used within advisor practices and across various divisions of retail wealth management intermediaries including broker/dealers, bank trust companies, registered investment advisors (RIAs), and family offices. The role will also involve supporting other research products and services across the retail wealth management research group.We are seeking a candidate with experience within either a financial advisor practice, at a wealth management intermediary such as a Broker/Dealer, RIA, or custodian, an organization serving or supporting financial advisors, a wealth management technology vendor, or a technology consulting organization. Responsibilities will include performing primary research, including research calls with technology vendors, financial advisors, wealth management home offices and other relevant industry professionals, building and fielding online surveys of financial advisors and other industry professionals, building and maintaining market models, authoring research reports analyzing the marketplace for wealth management technology, presenting research findings to clients and prospects, and performing technology vendor due diligenceThe position is ideal for someone who relevant experience and who is analytical, exhibits strong writing skills, works autonomously, is comfortable working on multiple project simultaneously, and seeks to build deep industry expertise. Successful candidates for this position are hardworking, persistent, and enthusiastic individuals with a passion for financial services industry research and analysis.Cerulli’s Wealth Management practice provides management consulting services and publishes research focusing on trends related to financial advisors and related intermediaries, including:In-depth competitive analysis and qualitative coverage of the wealth management industryNeeds, challenges, risks, and opportunities facing financial advisors and firms that employ themDistribution strategies for retail asset management products sold through financial advisorsResponsibilities and Duties:Supporting analyst for the annual State of U.S. Wealth Management Technology reportAssist in building and managing web surveys, including survey design, data gathering, data modeling and analysis, and exhibit creationRecruit industry professionals to participate in research interviews including financial advisors, executives at Broker/Dealers, RIAs, and wealth management technology vendors, and participate in all research calls performedAssisting in the development and ongoing management of analytical modelsSupport management consulting engagements across Cerulli’s Wealth Management practiceContribute to annual reports published by Cerulli’s Wealth Management practice including Broker/Dealer marketplace, RIA Marketplace, Advisor Metrics, and Intermediary Distribution, among others, as needed.Provide client-support, including conference calls and live presentations, related to Cerulli’s wealth management technology researchManage any necessary partnerships with industry trade associations, publications, and mediaThe position offers significant industry exposure, including interactions with senior executives throughout the industry, coverage in industry publications, and potentially presenting at conferences and events.Qualifications:Two to three years of experience in a capacity related to retail wealth management services or wealth management technologySuperior writing and communication skillsAptitude for synthesizing research, identifying trends, and providing commentary on relevant industry issuesAttention to detail and emphasis on accuracyStrong work ethic and a passion for the wealth management professionAbility to successfully execute on multiple initiatives simultaneously and meet deadlinesProficient in Excel; able to manipulate, and analyze sizeable amounts of dataExperience with Alteryx is a plusAbility to cultivate a network of industry contacts for research purposesCollege degree; completion of, or progress toward, MBA, CIMA®, CFP®, or CFA® is a plus

title: Category Insights Analyst (C797)
job_description: About The Wellness Pet CompanyThe Wellness Pet Company crafts and produces premium natural pet food, treats, dental chews, and supplements. We believe that natural, premium nutrition focused on proven health outcomes is the foundation of creating mutual wellbeing for pets and their families. As a community of people, Wellies are positively obsessed with how to win for pets and their parents. We believe in the difference we make every single day, and we know that when we work collaboratively, Wellies are unstoppable -- Not only in providing the best nutrition to pets, but in building a better tomorrow for pets, their parents, and the world. When you join Wellness Pet, you join a team whose aligned values and purpose create a unique and exciting place to work every day. Join us on our adventure to fulfill a life of wellbeing together with pets and their parents.What You’ll AccomplishOur Category Insights Analyst will be responsible for leading category-wide consumer analytics within the brand marketing team. Partnering with a team of channel-focused Sales Analysts and collaborating cross-functionally with various departments, this individual will play a crucial role in shaping sales strategies, optimizing business performance, and driving growth through data-driven insights. They will be a key business partner that provides deep category knowledge working with internal and external stakeholders, driving insights and actionable plans. They will also partner with our Sales Analysts to leverage shopper insights to deliver strategic alignment and drive execution across the omni-channel shopping environment. Reporting to the Director of Consumer Insights, our Analyst will source insights from revenue & POS data, as well as primary and secondary market research sources. In addition, their role will include:Category Level Analytics Leadership: Be the go-to source and subject matter expert across channels, at the category level. Directly support brand team to enable growth of each key business focus area.Data Expert: Subject matter expertise in all things Nielsen including Point of Sale, and panel analysis. Utilize multiple data sources, such as syndicated (IE Nielsen) and customer-provided consumption data, for analysis and trend identification.Business Intelligence: Convert sales information into actionable business intelligence that will drive revenue and profit for the team.Consumer and Customer Trends: Analyze and validate consumption and point-of-sale data to ensure an understanding of current consumer and customer trends and to inform marketing and sales strategies. Business Unit Analysis: Analyze business unit performance, including sales/share, forecasting, pricing analysis and elasticities, content audits, and digital shelf performance to enable the optimization of commercial strategies.Post-Promotional Analysis: Conduct post-promotional analysis (ROI, Cost to Acquire, Lifetime Value) and share the findings with the sales and marketing organization in order to improve future promotional efforts.Data Liaison: Management and maintenance of data sources and vendor relationships Market Intelligence: Communicate crucial market, trade, and competitive information in a timely manner.Reporting: Develop and support weekly standard reporting and ad hoc analytical needs of brand marketing team leveraging a suite of analytical tools. Who We’re Looking ForTeam Wellie is a group of people who are truly obsessed with all the best ways of winning for the consumer and the pets they love. And so, we are seeking an individual who:Is consumer focused on all they doContinually challenge themselves to go the extra mile to get the job done, and ensure it’s done the right way as opposed to the easy wayHold themselves and others accountableEmbraces continual development through the sharing of feedback and investment in learning opportunities.Is a true collaborator, sharing resources, and engages in healthy debateCelebrates differences and strives to learn from others who are different from themselvesGives back to their community and supports sustainable practicesIn addition, for this specific role, we need someone who possesses:Bachelor’s degree in business, or a related degree5+ years of experience in an analyst role, ideally in a sales or marketing capacity in CPGExtensive experience with syndicated data: IRI, Nielsen, as well as customer-provided point of sale (POS) dataStrong leadership, analytical, and communication skills, working with a variety of internal and external stakeholders to drive resultsPricing experience and subject matter expertise Successful experience managing and ensuring compatibility of large data sets across multiple platformsDemonstrated ability to translate financial and syndicated data into forward-looking action plansProven ability to perform sales ROI analysesExpert-level skills using Microsoft Excel, Power BI (or like system)Well-organized and able to manage multiple competing and shifting priorities and deadlinesSees challenges as opportunitiesAlways displays a professional attitudeWhy Work for Wellness PetWe care about the wellbeing of our people, their families, and their pets. We treat every Wellie to a comprehensive benefits package full of extras to support their health, pets, passions, and Professional Development. More information about our benefits can be found on our website.The Wellness Pet Company is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We celebrate diversity and are committed to equal employment opportunity regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or veteran status.

title: Principal Business System Analyst-(SAP-FI)
job_description: A Day in Your Life at MKS:We are looking for an exceptional Principal Business Systems Analyst- SAP-FI, who can perform development, implementation and usage of Information Technology and management information systems within SAP ERP applications. Working in partnership with the business relationship managers, super-users, end-users and technical team, ensure full adoption, effective usage, and efficient deployment of our IT solutions. Effectively manage the change control process, gathering the end-user requirements, and communicating IT priorities and delivery status to the business.You Will Make an Impact By:Provide our Finance functional leadership leveraging business process, SAP configuration and optimal usage expertise. Collaborate with our Accounting department (AR/AP), Credit department, Tax controller, Treasury management teams and IT in the global design, development, and deployment and expansion of the SAP landscapes. Support the Finance organization primarily Americas, Finance operations group end-user community by providing research, analysis and problem resolution to team members. Actively demonstrate a passion for continuous improvement focused on end user productivity, and enterprise process integration. Work with various business groups in the organization to facilitate cross-functional implementation of new or improved business process requirements for all IT-related business, financial, and operations systems critical to core organizational functions. Effectively manage the IT change control process, gathering the end-user requirements, preparing functional specifications and communicating IT priorities and delivery status to the business. Skills You Will Bring: Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Information Systems or a related technical field, or a Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or Finance, with a focus on information technology and SAP, including 5+ years of experience working in SAP applications, focusing on the Finance areas listed below. Minimum of 5 years of experience working in SAP applications, focusing on the Finance area: AR/AP, financial statements, banking interface, tax controlling and treasury management. Minimum of 7 years in SAP configurations and information technology experienceKnowledgeable in Order to Cash processes and understanding of integration with at least one of the third-party tools: Coupa, OneSource, Workday, Tax system, etc.) (at Least of One of them) Familiar with ABAPExperienced in MS Suite: PowerPoint, Excel- pivot tables, Word, etc. Must be fluent in English. Strong communication skills This position will be Hybrid at one of our MKS offices in the United States. Preferred Skills:Experience with tax determination tool as OneCloud (Thomson Reuters) is a plus. Strong team player with a can-do attitudeBe dissatisfied with status quo, with a thirst to introduce change. Compensation and Benefits:Salary Pay Range: $97,300 to $180,700 per year. This range is a good faith estimate of the expected salary range for this position, based on a wide range of factors including qualifications, experience and training, operational and business needs and other considerations permitted by law.  At MKS, it is not typical for an individual to be hired at or near the top of the range for the role.Bonus: This position is eligible for a discretionary annual bonus, in an amount to be determined by MKS [or as applicable].Benefits: MKS offers a comprehensive benefits package, including health insurance coverage (medical, dental and vision), 401(k) with company match, life and disability insurance, 12 paid holidays, sick time, 15 paid vacation days, [6 weeks fully paid] parental leave, adoption assistance and tuition reimbursement [and for participation in any stock programs, signing bonus, etc.].We are interested in qualified candidates who are eligible to work in the United States. However, we will not be sponsoring work visas for this position, at this time.

title: Senior Investment Operations Analyst - 24254
job_description: Senior Investment Operations AnalystWe are currently seeking candidates for a Senior Investment Operations Analyst opportunity with a highly successful Investment Management firm located in Boston, MA. The Senior Investment Operations Analyst will collaborate closely with Finance, Investment Operations, and Trade Operations teams. The ideal candidate will have 2-4+ years of hands-on investment operations, fund accounting, reconciliations, and/or trade operations experience within financial services.This opportunity includes $75,000-$95,000 base salary (depending on experience), strong bonuses, and excellent benefits.Key Perks: Great work-life balance, excellent benefits, commitment to DEIB, fantastic company culture, tremendous room for growth, and hybrid flexibility.Responsibilities: Collaborate with Finance, Investment Operations, and Trade Operations teams and Sr. leaders Perform reconciliations, research and resolve discrepancies, and reduce operational riskDeliver accurate cash projections to support portfolio management rebalancing efforts and cash flow projectionsReconcile daily cash balances, equity swaps, futures, and positions Partner with internal teams and conduct profit and loss reconciliations, reconcile Net Asset Values (NAV), and perform reportingSupport investment and trade operations processes, and coordinate with custodians, fund administrators, and vendors Provide additional support to special projects Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Economics, Business Administration, or a related field 2-4+ years of hands-on investment operations, fund accounting, reconciliations, and/or trade operations experience within financial services, asset management, and/or investment management Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Strong technical skills and proficiency in MS Office Suite (emphasis on Excel) Detail-oriented, highly organized, analytical, and deadline-driven Demonstrated ability to work successfully in a collaborative team environment as well as independently Intellectual curiosity and motivation to learn and grow For immediate consideration, interested and qualified candidates should send their resume to Jenny at jfriedman@daleyaa.com.

title: Senior Trade Operations Analyst - 24039
job_description: Senior Trade Operations Analyst- Investment Management- Boston, MAWe are seeking candidates for a Senior Trade Operations Analyst position with an industry-leading Investment Management firm based in Boston, MA. title: BI Analyst or Senior Analyst
job_description: Summary:As an internal Data and Analytics Specialist, you will extract, manipulate, organize, and report data from various sources within CFGI’s ecosystem. These systems currently include NetSuite (ERP), Salesforce (CRM), Pardot (Marketing Automation), and Oracle (EPM). This role requires an understanding of data structures, analytical skills, and proficiency in software tools such as Microsoft Excel and Microsoft PowerBI.Key Responsibilities:Extract data from NetSuite, Salesforce, Oracle, and other relevant sources using SQL queries, APIs, or other data extraction tools. Clean, transform, and manipulate raw data to ensure accuracy, consistency, and reliability. Perform data validation and quality assurance checks. Organize and structure data in a logical and coherent manner to facilitate analysis and reporting. Develop data models, hierarchies, and taxonomies to streamline data storage and retrieval processes. Analyze and present data to uncover trends, patterns, and insights that inform business decision-making. Generate recurring and ad-hoc reports and dashboards to communicate key performance metrics and insights across various levels of CFGI. Customize reports to meet the specific needs and preferences of different departments or teams. Stay informed of emerging trends, technologies, and best practices in data analytics and reporting. Identify opportunities for process improvement, automation, and optimization to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness at CFGI. Qualifications:Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related field. Three to five years of experience in data analysis, reporting, and visualization. Proficiency in SQL for data extraction and manipulation. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Proficiency in Microsoft Excel, including pivot tables, formulas, and macros. Proficiency with data visualization tools such as Microsoft PowerBI. Familiarity with data extraction from ERP systems (e.g., Netsuite), CRM systems (e.g., Salesforce), and EPM systems (e.g., Oracle). Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and communicate complex technical concepts in non-technical language. Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple priorities and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment.

title: Senior General / Interdisciplinary Engineer Analyst
job_description: Job DescriptionDCS Corp is recruiting for a Senior General/Interdisciplinary Engineer Analyst to support the Aerospace Dominance Enabler Division (AFLCMC/HBZ) at Hanscom AFB in Bedford, MA. HBZ functions as the Air Force’s technical, acquisition and sustainment experts providing unique and comprehensive support to the warfighter. The ADE Division is responsible for a vast array of USAF systems to include Electronic Warfare, Range Systems, Range Instrumentation, Air Combat Training and Aircrew Readiness, Command and Control Systems, Advanced Radar Threat Systems, Combat Survivor Evader Locator, P5 Combat Training Systems, Black Switch and Legacy Voice Systems. Furthermore, the ADE Division provides support to depot level sustainment and maintenance efforts, FMS, U.S. Army, Navy, Pacific Air Forces, Air Combat Command (ACC), Air Force Materiel Command (AFMC), and Air Education and Training Command (AETC) on a continuous basis.Essential Job Functions:Responsibilities may also include but are not limited to:Design & Architectures:Conduct and support all engineering and technical activities required during the material solution analysis, technology, engineering, and manufacturing development, production and deployment, and operation and support phases of the systems acquisition process. Develop/prepare engineering and technical documentation inherently part of the activities listed above (e.g. Analysis of Alternatives (AoA), Systems Engineering Plan (SEP)…), systems review and analysis with written reporting, briefing, and artifact development as required for all of the technical specialty areas defined in this section; and the planning and execution of all necessary technical reviews, assessments, and interchange meetings (e.g. Critical Design Review(CDR), Manufacturing Readiness Assessment (MRA), Reliability Technical Interchange Meeting (TIM)) and associated artifacts (e.g. Critical Design Review entry and exit criteria). Conduct systems architectural analyses to include system design/design feasibility and state-of-the-art assessment. Produce architectures, document planned and existing systems, determine-deficiencies, develop alternatives, recommend solutions, and support development of a plan to implement the chosen solution per acquisition and sustainment system engineering processes. This may include traditional architecture development or Model Based Systems Engineering processes. Track and ensure system architecture and interoperability requirements for the baselined system is maintained. Detail operational requirements and functional interactions within the system and with other systems, considering life cycle costs, logistics supportability, human factors, et al, to determine if the basic building blocks of the system are defined in sufficient detail to support a development program effort. Translate DoD user requirements into system requirements for designing, developing, testing and evaluating systems and subsystems using USAF and DoD approved acquisition methods. Provide engineering analysis of system training, training equipment and simulator requirements; prepare technical documentation; and provide engineering evaluation of equipment and simulator designs. Acquisition:Understand and implement robust DoD acquisition and sustainment systems engineering processes to address the life-cycle requirements of each product support area. Prepare and review program specifications for items, processes and materials. Develop and utilize analytical, simulation, MBSE and digital engineering analysis techniques to optimize system performance and/or system effectiveness; establish system sensitivities, define system parameters, evaluate hardware and validate flight test results in terms of overall system relationships and applications. Develop, prepare, review, and integrate selected milestone review documentation, periodic reports, and certifications as identified in current DoD and AF acquisition policy. Review, evaluate and monitor acquisition Contractor drawings for completeness, currency, technical accuracy and conformance to requirements, specifications, regulations and quality control to ensure compliance with ASME technical Data Package format and requirements. Technical Management:Complete and support requirements definition and analysis, architecture design, implementation, integration, verification and validation, transition, decision analysis, requirements management, risk management, interface management, and configuration management. Facilitate the transfer of information, lessons learned and best practices across all customers and contractors serviced under this task order within constraints of proprietary rights. Perform market research and trade studies to assess current and future systems to ensure they that meet mission needs/requirements. Conduct, define and evaluate system cost, schedule, and technical performance. Perform reviews, studies (including root cause analysis), audits, evaluations and analyses and provide technical recommendations to the Government. Conduct engineering performance, effectiveness, cost effectiveness, cost performance, life cycle cost, producibility, reliability and maintainability, risk and scheduling trade-off studies. Develop USAF approved Test and Evaluation Master Plans (TEMP), test plans and procedures, prepare test readiness reviews and associated test documentation using DoD and USAF standard processes, execute developmental tests and assist in operational test planning/execution, and evaluate tests in support of acquisition and sustainment programs. Participate in integrated logistics support efforts, provisioning and source coding, maintenance data collection, technical order management, configuration management, evaluation of quality deficiency reports, and/or identification of alternate sources of supply for diminishing manufacturing/materiel sources preferred. Required Skills:Due to the sensitivity of customer related requirements, U.S. Citizenship is required.A High School Diploma plus 15 years of experience, 8 of which must be in the DoD or a Bachelor's degree plus 12 years of experience, 5 of which must be in the DoD.An adjudicated DoD Secret Security clearance on the First Day of employment.Experience in engineering and technical resources with either USAF command or control reporting systems, tactical radar, shelter and radome systems, aircraft trainer pods, radios and communication systems, EW systems, or threat emitters depending on the specific branch needs.

title: Project Manager

project schedules, tasks, and actions adhering to FPI project management methodology by ensuring that recognized project management processes, discipline and controls are consistently applied to resources.Negotiate and issue additional project documentation as agreed to by the Project Sponsor with input from involved Stakeholders.OTHER DUTIES: This job description is not designed to cover or contain a full listing of activities, duties or responsibilities required of the employee for this job. Duties, responsibilities, and activities may change at any time with or without notice.QUALIFICATIONS: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent experience with five years of increasingly responsible experience in managing a variety of complex information technology projects, preferably in the financial services / banking industry.PMP certification preferred. Agile experience a plus.Proven success working with aggressive schedules and ambiguous requirements.Ability to make an impact, influence and achieve results with effective negotiation, problem-solving and communication skillsStrong knowledge and understanding of business needs, with the ability to establish and maintain an elevated level of customer trust and confidence.Strong problem solving and analytical skills. Detail oriented.Strong interpersonal skills, team interaction/effectiveness.Self-motivated and results oriented; able to manage multiple competing priorities and tasks effectively; able to work effectively with hard deadlines.Solid verbal and written communication skills, including documentation.Team player with ability to build and maintain strong working relationships with internal and external partnersAbility to create and foster a cohesive team and promote a positive work environment for all employees.Ability to understand and support corporate objectives, possess strong business acumenAbility to think strategically across the enterprise and possess strong business acumenProven ability to stay focused under pressure, demonstrating resilience in challenging situationsComfortable with ambiguity and ability to cope with rapid changeStrong leadership skills – lead by example, champion change and develop a highly motivated team to consistently exceed expectationsGood judgment— ability to determine which issues to escalate vs. to resolve independently, and provide suggestions for resolutionWORK ENVIRONMENT: Typical noise levels for an open, cubicle-styled environment. PHYSICAL DEMANDS: This position requires periods of standing, walking, and the use of computer equipment. Additional physical demands include, but may not be limited to, talking or hearing, push/pull, stooping, kneeling, reaching w/hands and arms, and lifting at least 10 pounds.WORK AUTHORIZATION: Authorization to work in the United States is required.REASONABLE ACCOMODATION: Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.For over 25 years, Farm Credit Financial Partners, Inc. (FPI) has provided technology products and services to the Farm Credit System. We care deeply about the agricultural credit associations (ACAs) we serve through our mission of delivering trusted technology solutions to help American agriculture thrive. As a customer-owned service organization, we support ACAs from Maine to California with over 62,000 customer-members and over $40 billion in loan volume. Everyone here contributes to the success of our customers, and to the vibrant culture that makes FPI a great place to work. Throughout the year, you will find us having fun and jamming out to FPI’s band, coming together to support local charities, and celebrating our wins together.We offer a robust benefits package that includes competitive earnings, hybrid and remote work options, tuition reimbursement, generous 401(k) matching, and development opportunities through company-sponsored trainings and certifications.Come grow with us: financialpartners.com.Farm Credit Financial Partners, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, national origin, sex or gender, religion, pregnancy, marital status, status as a veteran, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or any other characteristic protected by law. EEO / AA / Minorities / Female / Disabilities / VeteransAdditional InformationSpringfield, MA or Remote Available

title: Business Systems Analyst- Commercial IT
job_description: Some opportunities happen only once in a lifetime - like a job where you have the chance to change lives. At Alexion, people living with rare and devastating diseases are our Guiding Star. We are driven to continuously innovate and create meaningful value in all we do to help patients and families fully live their best lives. We value the uniqueness and diversity of our employees and recognize that nurturing the diverse perspectives and strengths of our people translates into innovative breakthroughs for patients.This is what you will do:The Business System Analyst serves as an innovative and collaborative business partner with responsibility for the successful delivery of solutions in support of strategic business initiatives. This individual must apply creative thinking, communication, analytical, and problem-solving skills to help maximize the benefit of our IT system investments. The Business System Analyst serves as a liaison between multiple business functions within the US Commercial areas and technology teams to define processes, identify process improvement opportunities, and implement new functionality that enable delivery of business objectives through the use of technology. This role will partner with a Project manager and Solution Delivery manager to ensure projects are managed to the original requirements, tested and delivered on time and on budget meeting business needs. for:Understand and prioritize business requirements from multiple collaborators applying specialist knowledge where applicable.Proactively seeks out opportunities to enhance and improve in line with strategic goals.Interpret business requirements and simplify them for easy analysis, solution design and decision making to positively impact/solve medium risks/issues.Effectively communicate impact, cost and benefits of new and changed demands.Provide insight & innovation to projects within own specialist area, aligning to Alexion/AZ IT strategy and working with Alexion/AZ IT partners.Work with business and IT Business partners to propose and deliver solutions to achieve agreed outcomes, ensuring that solutions fulfil their future strategic needs and challenges.Shape and define arguments, producing detailed business justification for investment including value and benefits realization.Work with colleagues across the technology teams, (e.g., architects and engineers) within the function to identify the capabilities required to ensure outcomes/requirements and clearly understood and can be delivered.Work with Process/Product owners to identify and devise solutions that optimize business process performance, capability, and competitiveness.Facilitate and lead design sessions with the business and implementation team to identify functional and technical requirements.Defining project scope and goals for small projects that deliver or support delivery of effective solutions.Setting a budget and schedule.Hands on leadership, planning, coordination, and delivery of aspects of key projects, including facilitation of meetings, tracking, reporting and communicating progress, as well as risks and issues as necessary.Collate information from relevant sources for analysis and reporting relevant data trends for informed decision making for positive business impact.Communicate with the relevant collaborators and transfer relevant knowledge to delivery teams, i.e., translation using levels of interactive communication and influencing skills. Contributes to communication plans and organizational change for project and collaborators.Supports business for service tracking/issues/problems/incidents, as well as with IT satisfaction and improvements. Captures delivery feedback from customers.You will need to have: 3-5 Years of experience as a Business AnalystPrevious experience working in a pharmaceutical or life sciences background or equivalentDemonstrable experience of successfully managing IT projects end to end, both waterfall and agileDemonstrable experience of working with complex integrated systems, using creative and critical thinking to deliver exceptional resultsStrong engagement, communication and customer management skills, including presentation and influencing skillsExperience of working in a regulated environmentThe duties of this role are generally conducted in an office environment. As is typical of an office-based role, employees must be able, with or without an accommodation to: use a computer; engage in communications via phone, video, and electronic messaging; engage in problem solving and non-linear thought, analysis, and dialogue; collaborate with others; maintain general availability during standard business hours.We would prefer for you to have: Bachelor’s degree in a biopharmaceutical or IT field is preferred.Strong understanding of project management methodologies.Pharmaceutical business background with experience supporting Patient Services organizations is preferredExperience of virtual teamwork to lead, shape and develop innovative solutionsExperience of working with and managing third party suppliers/vendorsWhen we put unexpected teams in the same room, we unleash bold thinking with the power to inspire life-changing medicines. In-person working gives us the platform we need to connect, work at pace and challenge perceptions. That’s why we work, on average, a minimum of three days per week from the office. But that doesn’t mean we’re not flexible. We balance the expectation of being in the office while respecting individual flexibility. Join us in our unique and ambitious world.AstraZeneca requires all US employees to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 but will consider requests for reasonable accommodations as required by applicable law.AstraZeneca embraces diversity and equality of opportunity. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse team representing all backgrounds, with as wide a range of perspectives as possible, and harnessing industry-leading skills. We believe that the more inclusive we are, the better our work will be. We welcome and consider applications to join our team from all qualified candidates, regardless of their characteristics. We comply with all applicable laws and regulations on non-discrimination in employment (and recruitment), as well as work authorization and employment eligibility verification requirements. #HYBRID

title: Senior Portfolio Analyst
job_description: A Venture Capital firm based in Cambridge, MA is looking to hire a Senior Portfolio Analyst.
